name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
review: Finally support for Alexa!  And it actually works well (so far)

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
comment heading: Creates an "Alexa" Shopping List and ignores my shopping list
review:
I use AnyList for sharing various shopping lists with my family, so anyone can add stuff without having to wait until I'm around or we've already shopped.
Super annoying that adding something to AnyList via Alexa adds a shopping list called "Alexa" instead of using my list.  Would be a billionjillion times better if I could specify which list.

name: MatHem.se
description:
Shop groceries at MatHem.se using your voice. You ask Alexa for products in English and we'll translate it to Swedish before adding it to your cart.

Please note that this skill requires account linking with an existing account at MatHem.se.

Please also note that this is a product targeting https://www.mathem.se. To place orders using the skill you will need to have a previously placed order through https://www.mathem.se.

When you ask for a product, for example 'milk', we'll translate milk into Swedish and perform a category search for it. We order the results based on your previous orders, so if your preference is organic lactose free milk, that is what you will get.

To prevent unintentional purchases we recommend you to add a four digit pincode that you will be prompted to say before placing your order. Your cart and orders are synced in real-time to https://www.mathem.se and the mobile apps, so if you require more advanced features, please use a device with a visual interface.

You are also welcome to contact our customer support by phone, chat or email: https://www.mathem.se/kundtjanst/kontakt

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!
review: Been using Bring for years, and I love the Alexa integration.  Just what I need to be able to add stuff to my shopping list without having to get off my ass or fumble with my phone.  Maybe the negative reviews I see here are from before they got kinks worked out, because when I tell Alexa to open Bring and add something, it works fine.

name: 1-800-Flowers
description:
Send truly original and unique floral arrangements, plants and gifts in minutes with the 1-800-Flowers Skill. Simply enable Amazon Pay on your Alexa App, and you can start gifting with our 1-800-Flowers Skill! 

Find gifts for any occasion with ease by telling Alexa what type of gift you’re looking for (roses, sunflowers, gift baskets, chocolates, etc.) and Alexa will recommend one of our curated gifts from our Family of Brands for you to send. Not sure what gift you want to send? Simply tell Alexa who you would like to send a gift to (wife, mom, co-worker, grandparent, friend) and for what occasion (birthday, anniversary, graduation, sympathy, housewarming, holidays), and Alexa will recommend one of our truly original gifts. 

To complete the transaction, answer a few quick questions about the recipient’s delivery address and delivery date and pay with Amazon Pay. Your recipient will be receiving their gift with a smile shortly!

Meet Our Family of Brands:
[+] Cheryl’s Cookies
[+] FruitBouquets.com
[+] 1800Baskets.com
[+] Simply Chocolate
[+] Personalization Universe
[+] The Popcorn Factory
[+] Harry and David
[+] Wolferman’s
[+] Stock Yards
review: have an account, wont link! :( total waste of time

name: Fashion Island
description: Fashion Island is here to help you find out more about shops and amenities at Fashion Island Shopping Center in Newport Beach.  If you're in search of a store, a service or a bite to eat, you can now find it instantly by simply asking the Fashion Island Alexa Skill. Try it! Simply ask questions like, "Alexa, ask Fashion Island, where is Neiman Marcus located?" or " Alexa, ask Fashion Island, where I can valet?" or " Alexa, ask Fashion Island,  where are the restrooms?" and our IBM Watson-enhanced guest services experience will help you shop and navigate Fashion Island instantly. Go ahead and try it out. We're always here and At Your Service.

name: REI Co-op
description:
The REI Co-op voice assistant allows Alexa to provide REI's Deal of the Day, REI store locations, equipment rental information, and up-to-date information on REI classes, events and garage sales.

REI is a national outdoor retail co-op dedicated to inspiring, educating, and outfitting its members and the community for a lifetime of outdoor adventure and stewardship.

To get started, enable the REI Co-op skill. Then just say:

"Alexa, ask REI about the Deal of the Day"
"Alexa, ask REI what garage sales are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what garage sales are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI to find stores near me"
"Alexa, ask REI to find stores near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what classes are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what classes are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what events are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what events are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what equipment can I rent near me"
"Alexa, ask REI what equipment can I rent near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI about the benefits of becoming an REI Co-op member"

Alternatively, you can start an interactive session by saying: "Alexa, start REI"

name: Best Buy
description:
Get Best Buy's latest deals using only your voice. You can also search for products, track your order status, hear store hours and locations, and get answers to frequently asked questions.

For the best shopping experience, take a moment to link your Best Buy account. And to make ordering even easier, make sure you have a default credit card and shipping address stored at BestBuy.com. If while using our skill you choose to have a text sent with more information, Best Buy will need access to your Amazon account mobile number.  Go to the home screen in your Alexa app to grant permission.

Use the Best Buy skill to:
- Buy our latest deals, including special voice-only offers
- Search our product catalog
- Get updated order status information
- Locate a store near you
- Learn about Best Buy’s return policy, or get answers to other FAQs
- Ask for tech tips like, "how do I set a default printer" or "help me with my modem"
- Discover gift ideas or purchase Best Buy gift cards
comment heading: This is awesome! I love being able shop the Deal of ...
review: This is awesome! I love being able shop the Deal of the Day at Best Buy from my Echo device. It's the best of both worlds. Kudos!

name: Supreme Golf
description:
Booking a Tee Time with Supreme Golf on Alexa is easy. You can search by city, zip or course name. Commonly used filters include day/time, price, distance (from your location) and course rating. Upon selecting the best tee time for you Supreme Golf intuitively makes the checkout process seamless and secure. Using our machine learning tools we will recommend the best deals for your search criteria. The best part, the more you use Supreme Golf, the smarter it gets. Download the Supreme Golf app and start saving on your tee times today!

This skill uses Amazon Pay to process your payments. To help protect against unwanted ordering, you can enable a four-digit voice code under Settings in the Alexa app.
review:
Thanks Supreme Golf!

In this setting where there are so many variables (e.g. while golf course, players, holes, timing, price etc) you really made it so easy for booking tee-time. It also moves the effort by simplifying repeat booking with a simple command.

name: GiftJoy
description:
Welcome to GiftJoy - the new, convenient, and enjoyable way to instantly send eGift cards to family and friends! 

You can choose from over 100 top retailers such as Starbucks, Fandango, Sephora, Barnes & Noble, Applebee's, Domino's, Uber, Nordstrom, Target, Old Navy, Kohl's, and Nike.  

Simply tell Alexa your order by saying: 

"Alexa, open GiftJoy!" or "Alexa, ask GiftJoy to send a gift card."

Through voice, you'll be prompted for your order details such as your name, the recipient's name, the gift card brand and value, when you want the eGift card to be delivered, and your personalized greeting.  

You'll then get a text message with a link to review your order and enter your payment details.  So don't worry if you make a mistake, you'll be able to easily make edits in the next step. 

The recipient will get a text message (or email, if you prefer) with a link to the eGift card, which can be redeemed online or in-store.  PLUS: if they prefer a different brand, they can make a swap without any fees.  That means you'll always be sending the perfect gift!

After you've placed an order, you can ask for your order history.  "Alexa, ask GiftJoy for my order history."  You'll also get notified  (via email) when the recipient opens their gift. 

Happy Gifting!!

We'd love to hear about your GiftJoy experience: team@giftjoy.us
Our website: giftjoy.us
List of Retailers: giftjoy.us/retailers
comment heading: I Went from Underwhelmed to Absolute Fan
review:
Update - April 11, 2019:
I have unsuccessfully attempted to edit my review three times, which left no alternative but to delete it. Luckily I always write my reviews in another program in case of a glitch. Below you will find my original review and the update.

Update - Attempted April 8th, 9th & 10th:
I received a prompt response from customer service apologizing for the delay and reassure me that they were working to resolve the problem as possible. The resolution process was simple and quick (taking less than 24 hours), and the customer service team kept in contact in regular intervals through until the issue was resolved. That alone was enough to make me want to update my review and give them five stars. But they didn't stop there. After everything was resolved on my end, they checked back again to make sure the recipient had received the gift and was able to apply it with no issues on that end. I will definitely keep GiftJoy in my arsenal of gift giving options.

Original Review - April 6, 2019:
Setting up the skill was fairly easy. The ability to review and finalize the order on your phone was especially helpful since Alexa's voice recognition capabilities continue to get worse. The person I sent a gift card to received the email from GiftJoy right away and clicked accept, which then took him to a page that said his card was processing. That was more than 12 hours ago. I don't know if this situation is a fluke or random glitch. Either way, it's not a very auspicious start. As it stands now, there is no joy related to this gift. I sent an email, but have not received a response yet. If/when the issue gets resolved I will update my review to reflect that.

name: Purell
description:
PURELL® products are trusted and used in hospitals to help prevent the spread of infection. Now that same germ-fighting power is available for everyone - at home, at work and on the go. 

From innovative soap and sanitizer formulation, to breakthrough dispensing systems and portable solutions, the same commitment to well-being goes into every product we make.

We bring that same commitment to our new Amazon Alexa skill, PURELL® Assistant, which will share our hand hygiene and sanitation know-how with new and long-time friends alike. Use this skill to find out more about our gentle, effective products and to hear tips for keeping your family healthy and well.

Disclaimer: The information in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.
review: I was wondering if using purell would dry out my hands and it told me it wouldn't! This made me want to use hand sanitizer.

name: Out Of Milk
description:
With Out of Milk, manage your shopping list with just your voice. Easily add or remove various products and sync your lists with family and friends. Out of Milk lets you keep track of all of your lists, and automatically syncs to your phone. Keep your pantry and your fridge fresh!


Our Features:
-Easily create and edit your shopping lists
- Sync your shopping lists in real-time
- Quickly add and remove items on your lists
- Manage an inventory of your pantry
- Keep your lists synced from Alexa to your phone

You can always access your lists through our mobile apps and online on our website: http://www.outofmilk.com/. 


WHAT THE EXPERTS ARE SAYING:

'The Out of Milk app is straightforward and offers three main list functions: shopping, pantry and to do.'

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!
comment heading: Bring (the Android App) is available for Canadians via the ...
review:
Bring (the Android App) is available for Canadians via the Play Store, but the Bring Skill is not available to Canadian Alexa users.

Please add this Skill to Amazon Canada.

name: Nintendo Switch US eShop Deals (Unofficial)
description:
Get the latest games to go on sale on the Nintendo eShop including price and OpenCritic score.  Updated daily for this Flash Briefing.

Data is automatically generated using public data feeds from Nintendo and OpenCritic.  While I endeavour to make this briefing as accurate as possible there are sometimes issues with the data feeds.  
Please visit https://www.switchdiscounts.com for more.

name: GiftJoy
description:
Welcome to GiftJoy - the new, convenient, and enjoyable way to instantly send eGift cards to family and friends! 

You can choose from over 100 top retailers such as Starbucks, Fandango, Sephora, Barnes & Noble, Applebee's, Domino's, Uber, Nordstrom, Target, Old Navy, Kohl's, and Nike.  

Simply tell Alexa your order by saying: 

"Alexa, open GiftJoy!" or "Alexa, ask GiftJoy to send a gift card."

Through voice, you'll be prompted for your order details such as your name, the recipient's name, the gift card brand and value, when you want the eGift card to be delivered, and your personalized greeting.  

You'll then get a text message with a link to review your order and enter your payment details.  So don't worry if you make a mistake, you'll be able to easily make edits in the next step. 

The recipient will get a text message (or email, if you prefer) with a link to the eGift card, which can be redeemed online or in-store.  PLUS: if they prefer a different brand, they can make a swap without any fees.  That means you'll always be sending the perfect gift!

After you've placed an order, you can ask for your order history.  "Alexa, ask GiftJoy for my order history."  You'll also get notified  (via email) when the recipient opens their gift. 

Happy Gifting!!

We'd love to hear about your GiftJoy experience: team@giftjoy.us
Our website: giftjoy.us
List of Retailers: giftjoy.us/retailers
review: It's easy to use. You simply just tell your Alexa device and it computes everything for you. I strongly recommend customers who have Alexas to use this.

name: Slick Dealer
description: This is an unofficial Skill for the Slick Deals web application. Its purpose is to read from the list of frontpage deals or popular deals found on the Slick Deals website.

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
comment heading: This skill is a great start! It would be even more useful if ...
review: This skill is a great start! It would be even more useful if AnyList worked with the Amazon Echo Show to display recipes.

name: Purell
description:
PURELL® products are trusted and used in hospitals to help prevent the spread of infection. Now that same germ-fighting power is available for everyone - at home, at work and on the go. 

From innovative soap and sanitizer formulation, to breakthrough dispensing systems and portable solutions, the same commitment to well-being goes into every product we make.

We bring that same commitment to our new Amazon Alexa skill, PURELL® Assistant, which will share our hand hygiene and sanitation know-how with new and long-time friends alike. Use this skill to find out more about our gentle, effective products and to hear tips for keeping your family healthy and well.

Disclaimer: The information in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.
review: I asked this skill how to best sanitize my countertops and microwave and it told me how to best do it using their products. Sweet!

name: Redbox
description: The Redbox Alexa skill allows you discover what new release movies and games are available at your local Redbox kiosks.  You can ask about specific titles, or what is new this week.  You can also learn about the plot, the rating, and who stars in a movie.
review: This app doesn't even have the basics, like costs, due dates, etc. Redbox really needs to up thier game.

name: Secret Santa Gift Ideas
description: Having trouble finding the gift for your Secret Santa event? Look no further! This skill will suggest cheap and fun gift ideas for your Secret Santa event!

name: Kit
description: Ask Kit to recommend products for your hobbies, gifts, or for getting things done.  Kit will find the best products and gear from top experts and influencers.
comment heading: Ask Kit is a great hands free recommendation skill - fun for discovering some new items
review:
Sometimes you just want to know a great product recommendation, and Kit is a great way to get one. I use kit.com to post my own additions, but having the Kit skill is a great way to get a quick answer without picking up my phone or computer.

Great skill to have around also when you want to get an expert opinion fast on a product vs combing through search results.

name: Edmunds
description:
Edmunds brings more than 50 years of automotive knowledge to your Alexa-enabled device with a  new way to access car shopping and ownership tools. Now, Alexa can help you shop for a car, appraise a vehicle, calculate cost of ownership, find out when your next service is due, and much more. 

Available topics: pros and cons, driving characteristics, safety, powertrain, warranty, fuel efficiency, seating capacity, length, width, height, price, cost, cargo capacity, headroom, curb weight, towing capacity, wheelbase, inventory, lease deals, dealers, recalls, maintenance, and true market value.

name: Best Buy
description:
Get Best Buy's latest deals using only your voice. You can also search for products, track your order status, hear store hours and locations, and get answers to frequently asked questions.

For the best shopping experience, take a moment to link your Best Buy account. And to make ordering even easier, make sure you have a default credit card and shipping address stored at BestBuy.com. If while using our skill you choose to have a text sent with more information, Best Buy will need access to your Amazon account mobile number.  Go to the home screen in your Alexa app to grant permission.

Use the Best Buy skill to:
- Buy our latest deals, including special voice-only offers
- Search our product catalog
- Get updated order status information
- Locate a store near you
- Learn about Best Buy’s return policy, or get answers to other FAQs
- Ask for tech tips like, "how do I set a default printer" or "help me with my modem"
- Discover gift ideas or purchase Best Buy gift cards

name: Ebook Selector
description:
Ebook Selector is a skill to help you select the Best Kindle Ebooks on Amazon.  Select your favorite Kindle Books. Make your own choice!

1. Just tell Alexa what Genre you like and she will choose the best book for you.  
2.  Then, place an order and enjoy reading it! (Alexa can also read it for you. )

That's it! We UPDATE our selection process every 2 weeks. So you can get a fresh selection of books every single time. 

You can say:

"Alexa, open Ebook Selector "
"Alexa, start Ebook Selector "
"Alexa, launch Ebook Selector  "

More 5 star reviews = more new features and development in this app.  

Privacy Policy:
All these books belong to the individual person who published it. We are transmitting it from best and random sources available on the internet.

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at vignesh2406@gmail.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!

name: AnyList
description:

comment heading: A must have!! Been waitng for this since I got Alexa.
review:
I loved being able to easily add items to a shopping or to do list with Alexa.

I absolutely hated trying to use the Alexa app on my phone to grocery shop.  Every time you unlock the phone the app has to completely reload then click on lists then shopping list.  Absolute garbage.

With AnyList all my Alexa lists are synced directly to the phone.  Best thing ever.  It even has some other nice features like recipes.  I plan on buying at least a one year upgrade just to support the app.

And for custom lists if you create them on Alexa first, just create a list with the same name on AnyList and it will be synced.  If you create the list on AnyList first then just select Sync with Alexa and it will automatically be available with Alexa.

name: Brad's Deals
description:
This skill lets you create personalized deal alerts from Brad’s Deals. Simply tell Alexa what you’re shopping for, and you will get handpicked deals from our editors to your inbox. Think of it as your free, personal shopper and deal expert.

Deal Alerts are an easy way to make sure you don’t miss the best prices on what you’re shopping for year round. 
—Add deal alerts based on your shopping needs. 
—Create alerts by category or specific item.
—Save time with deals researched to be the best price and value.
—Discover exclusives and savings you might not know about.

Tip: Use this skill for your holiday shopping list so you’re notified right away when we find awesome deals on this year’s hottest items!

comment heading: Misunderstood command deletes the entire list
review:
Alexa has some serious issues with this app. It seems that Alexa only understands food related items. and when it doesn't understand something it deletes your whole shopping list. I asked it today to add "school supplies" which should be fairly easy thing to add. Instead Alexa didn't understand the command and deleted my entire list! I have to assume this is an Alexa issue as I can add anything I want to the out of milk app/website.

Several have complained about this but nothing seems to be done - no response or acknowledgement from the Alexa support team.

It would be nice to know they are actually looking at the reviews and doing something about the bugs.

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!
review: It works great. To set the default list, you have to open Bring first. Otherwise, work as expected.

review: It started working perfectly. Then one day she said I can use it with my language. I ask her what my language is and she said English. It setting on the skill says English US and English GB. All ten of my echos, spots, dots and shows had to be set to English US. Even though we are officially recognised by Amazon now all of the skills still only recognise English US or GB. There is no AU.  I guess I can talk like a yank til we are completely integrated in to the English speakers of the world. Meh, at least it works now.

name: Brad's Deals
description:

Deal Alerts are an easy way to make sure you don’t miss the best prices on what you’re shopping for year round. 
—Add deal alerts based on your shopping needs. 
—Create alerts by category or specific item.
—Save time with deals researched to be the best price and value.
—Discover exclusives and savings you might not know about.

Tip: Use this skill for your holiday shopping list so you’re notified right away when we find awesome deals on this year’s hottest items!

name: MailHaven Package Tracker
description:
This skill requires users to have an account via the Mailhaven iOS app (see download link below).

Download the Mailhaven iOS app here 

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/mailhaven/id1189399189?ls=1&mt=8

Generally, a user will have packages being shipped to them and tracked on mailhaven app. This skill will allow users to ask mailhaven for information on their packages.

A user can ask for a status of all their undelivered packages. A user can also ask for the status of their last updated package (this package could be delivered, or in transit, etc...).
review: All you have to do is log in your tracking order or use your mailhaven email and you can ask alexa anytime where your packages are!! so great to keep up with my delievering packages, especially since I live in an apartment complex!

name: Lamps Plus Order Status
description:
Use Alexa to ask questions about all your Lamps Plus orders.  Get status updates or answers to other frequently asked questions anytime you like with the voice-activated convenience you love from Alexa.

We can help you locate a store near by where you can find our products.

To help you find a store quickly, we will need your device's location.  We will need your permission to access this information by having you enable GEO location on your device.  If GEO location is not available, we can also use the address assigned to your Alexa account with your permission.

We also have other ways to help you find a local store.  If the location information is not available from your device, we can use the address listed in your recent orders or we will ask you for your current location.
review: I had a matching pair by each side of my bed.  They were filled with white beach sand and sea shells I had found. One of my cats knocked one over and shattered it. I saw your replacement on sale and immediately ordered it.  Thank you so much.

name: GiftJoy
description:
Welcome to GiftJoy - the new, convenient, and enjoyable way to instantly send eGift cards to family and friends! 

You can choose from over 100 top retailers such as Starbucks, Fandango, Sephora, Barnes & Noble, Applebee's, Domino's, Uber, Nordstrom, Target, Old Navy, Kohl's, and Nike.  

Simply tell Alexa your order by saying: 

"Alexa, open GiftJoy!" or "Alexa, ask GiftJoy to send a gift card."

Through voice, you'll be prompted for your order details such as your name, the recipient's name, the gift card brand and value, when you want the eGift card to be delivered, and your personalized greeting.  

You'll then get a text message with a link to review your order and enter your payment details.  So don't worry if you make a mistake, you'll be able to easily make edits in the next step. 

The recipient will get a text message (or email, if you prefer) with a link to the eGift card, which can be redeemed online or in-store.  PLUS: if they prefer a different brand, they can make a swap without any fees.  That means you'll always be sending the perfect gift!

After you've placed an order, you can ask for your order history.  "Alexa, ask GiftJoy for my order history."  You'll also get notified  (via email) when the recipient opens their gift. 

Happy Gifting!!

We'd love to hear about your GiftJoy experience: team@giftjoy.us
Our website: giftjoy.us
List of Retailers: giftjoy.us/retailers
review: Well that was super easy and quick...

review: I’ve been doing almost exactly what this skill does with a couple of IFTTT recipes. However, with IFTTT I had to make sure I opened AnyList on my iPhone so the items would import successfully into shared lists before my husband could see them on his iPhone. Now they just show up. No import process. It also happens nearly instantaneously, whereas there was a delay with the IFTTT method. The only thing I wish were different is the ability to rename the lists once they’re linked. I use “shopping list” for grocery store items and “to-do list” for wholesale club items.

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
review:
I subscribed to AnyList family thinking I could get my elderly parents to just add items via the app. Having the ability to just say “Alexa add ...” is awesome. The fact that it automatically updates all of us is a bonus. Even better is how my Apple Watch goes “bong” and tells me when my list has been modified. I can literally be at the grocery store and have items added without having to stop and take a call. No more trying to decipher texts from the spelling challenged either!

As for whining about privacy, that went away when we entered the digital world. If you want privacy, stop using mobile devices, computers, Amazon Echo, etc. It is the price you pay for technological convenience. There’s no reason to leave a bad review because of it.

name: My Deal
description:
We find hundreds of deals every day and can’t wait to share with you. We tailor deals that interests you.. Tell us which deals you like, as we get to know you better, we will target deals that fits your preferences.

You will receive a four-character personal code (such as“DEMO”), which you can use to review the detail of the deals that you liked at www.mydealweb.com.


How to use:

To launch:
     “ Alexa, open my deal. ”

To search for particular deals by keyword (For example: Amazon, iPhone, Women's Outerwear):
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of Amazon. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal what are the deals for iPhone. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal to tell me the deals for women's outerwear. ”

If you find deals you are interested in, like them by numbers and view the detail on your phone:
     “ one, two and four ”
     “ second and third ”
     “ first two ”
     “ last one ”

Or go to the next group:
     “ next ”

Or want to listen again:
     “ repeat ”

Of cause you can always get help by:
     “ help ”

Or exist any time by:
     “ Alexa, stop. ”


How did we grow up:

Mar-18-2017:

	Now we can search for deals by keyword! Just say: “Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of (Keyword).”

Mar-08-2017:

	Now we have a website “www.mydealweb.com”, where you can review the deals you liked with your personal code! 

Feb-28-2017:

	Your deals are not randomly selected any more. They are based on what you liked before!

Feb-18-2017:

	Choose the deals you like by the Deal Number, we will send the detail via the Alexa App!

Feb-08-2017:

	Now you can listen to the next group of deals by saying “Next” or the previous group of deals by saying “Repeat”, and get help any time by saying “Help”.

Jan-28-2017:

	Launched! With 5 deals every time.


We're always learning and building new features, and we can't do that well without your feedback. If you have comments, please share them with us at www.mydealweb.com/feedback.

name: Edmunds
description:
Edmunds brings more than 50 years of automotive knowledge to your Alexa-enabled device with a  new way to access car shopping and ownership tools. Now, Alexa can help you shop for a car, appraise a vehicle, calculate cost of ownership, find out when your next service is due, and much more. 

Available topics: pros and cons, driving characteristics, safety, powertrain, warranty, fuel efficiency, seating capacity, length, width, height, price, cost, cargo capacity, headroom, curb weight, towing capacity, wheelbase, inventory, lease deals, dealers, recalls, maintenance, and true market value.

name: Best Buy
description:
Get Best Buy's latest deals using only your voice. You can also search for products, track your order status, hear store hours and locations, and get answers to frequently asked questions.

For the best shopping experience, take a moment to link your Best Buy account. And to make ordering even easier, make sure you have a default credit card and shipping address stored at BestBuy.com. If while using our skill you choose to have a text sent with more information, Best Buy will need access to your Amazon account mobile number.  Go to the home screen in your Alexa app to grant permission.

Use the Best Buy skill to:
- Buy our latest deals, including special voice-only offers

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!
comment heading: Bring is awesome and so is this skill
review: I love Bring on my phone and Moto 360 Android Wear watch, and now I can finally add list items with my voice too. Thank you for this skill, I love it! And it actually works. Alexa just got 2x more useful!

name: Produce Checker
description: PLU codes administered by the International Federation for Produce Standards (IFPS) are 4 or 5 digit identification numbers affixed to a produce in grocery stores The PLU number identifies produce items based upon various attributes which can include the commodity, the variety, the growing methodology (e.g. organic) and the size group. This skill helps you to find the details of a produce by asking its PLU code. All results are based on the data available on the IFPS website as on 7/6/2017

Send truly original and unique floral arrangements, plants and gifts in minutes with the 1-800-Flowers Skill. Simply enable Amazon Pay on your Alexa App, and you can start gifting with our 1-800-Flowers Skill! 

Find gifts for any occasion with ease by telling Alexa what type of gift you’re looking for (roses, sunflowers, gift baskets, chocolates, etc.) and Alexa will recommend one of our curated gifts from our Family of Brands for you to send. review: very nice &  Easy to use

name: Food Tracker
description:
Food Tracker can keep track of the expiration dates of food. You can add and remove items from Food Tracker and ask Food Tracker when items expire. This skill is best used as you are putting away your groceries after going to the store.


To start, add an item with an expiration date, you could say:

"Alexa, create expiration date for [item] on [date] using Food Tracker"

The same item cannot be added twice to the list.


You can do the following things with Food Tracker:
- Add expiration dates for items
"Alexa, add expiration date for [item] on [date] using Food Tracker"
- Check if an item is in the list
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker is [item] in my list"
- Get expiration dates for items
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker, when does [item] expire"
- Get how long before items expire
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker, how long before [item] expires"
- Check if an item has expired
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker has [item] expired" 
- Get number of expired items
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker how many items have expired"
- Get list of expired items
"Alexa, get all expired items from Food Tracker"
- Get the next expiring item
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker what item is expiring next"
- Get a list of all items
"Alexa, get all items from Food Tracker"
- Get number of all items
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker how many items are in my list"
- Delete an item
"Alexa, remove [item] from Food Tracker"
- Delete all expired items
"Alexa, delete all expired items from Food Tracker"
- Delete all items (BE CAREFUL!)
"Alexa, delete all items in my list from Food Tracker"

Slight variations of the above commands will also work.

NOTE: Disabling and enabling the Food Tracker skill will delete all items in your list.

Additional functionality will be added over time.

Icon made by Madebyoliver (https://www.flaticon.com/authors/madebyoliver) from www.flaticon.com

name: BJ's Wholesale Club
description:
The BJ’s Wholesale Club skill enables you to learn more about your available My BJ’s Perks® Awards, Membership status, and BJ’s Gas® prices.

For now, use the BJ’s skill to inquire about:
-   Available BJ’s Perks® Awards associated with your Membership account;
-   Current Membership status and expiration date; and
-   BJ’s Gas® prices near you.

And, we’re just getting started with more exciting skill enhancements to come in the future.  Please stay tuned for updates.

Please note, before you start using this skill, you will need to link your BJ’s online account. If you don’t have an online account, you will need to create your account first to access the BJ’s skill.
review:
BJs delivered a broken dishwasher and took months to replace with new one, causing us major life inconvenience.
On 9/12/2018 we ordered a "Whirlpool Dishwasher with 1-Hour Wash Cycle - Stainless Steel" (Item ID: 99372) from BJs online and were informed it would be delivered in early October.

However, it was not delivered until late October while I was away on a business trip, at 7am on a Monday morning, with my wife receiving only 10 minutes warning by phone.

The delivery person took away our old dishwasher, which was still perfectly functional, and installed the new one, which did not work. He said it was a problem with our wall wiring and left without verifying with my wife.

Later that day we hired a handyman to investigate, and he concluded our wall wiring was fine and it was the dishwasher which was broken.

The following week Whirlpool sent over a representative who verified the dishwasher was defective.

It took another few weeks, with many frustrating calls to BJs (whose customer service agents were very cold and impolite) to finally deliver and install another functional dishwasher. By that time my wife had already been inconvenienced for almost two months -- she has a disability and cannot wash dishes by hand, so had to take our children out to eat every day.

The worst part of this is that when we complained to the Better Business Bureau BJs lied that we were fully compensated for our losses. Hence I resort here to record our painful lesson: let everyone be warned BJs Online is a dishonest and broken business! Shop elsewhere!

name: Kit
description: Ask Kit to recommend products for your hobbies, gifts, or for getting things done.  Kit will find the best products and gear from top experts and influencers.
comment heading: Surprisingly on point with recognizing what you're asking for
review: Alexa Skills usually suck at recognizing your voice and natural language, but this Kit skill seems remarkably responsive and accurate, giving me immediate suggestions for "vlogging camera", "robotic vaccuum cleaner", "hair dryer", "stocking stuffers", "smart home device" (ironically it recommended Chromecast and not Amazon Echo :P). Unfortunately the Skill didn't have any recommendations for "faded jeans" but did manage to recognize the term and repeat it back to me accurately. Maybe other Skills set my standards too low, but I'm duly impressed.

name: REI Co-op
description:
The REI Co-op voice assistant allows Alexa to provide REI's Deal of the Day, REI store locations, equipment rental information, and up-to-date information on REI classes, events and garage sales.

REI is a national outdoor retail co-op dedicated to inspiring, educating, and outfitting its members and the community for a lifetime of outdoor adventure and stewardship.

To get started, enable the REI Co-op skill. Then just say:

"Alexa, ask REI about the Deal of the Day"
"Alexa, ask REI what garage sales are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what garage sales are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI to find stores near me"
"Alexa, ask REI to find stores near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what classes are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what classes are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what events are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what events are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what equipment can I rent near me"
"Alexa, ask REI what equipment can I rent near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI about the benefits of becoming an REI Co-op member"

Alternatively, you can start an interactive session by saying: "Alexa, start REI"

name: Purell
description:
PURELL® products are trusted and used in hospitals to help prevent the spread of infection. Now that same germ-fighting power is available for everyone - at home, at work and on the go. 

From innovative soap and sanitizer formulation, to breakthrough dispensing systems and portable solutions, the same commitment to well-being goes into every product we make.

We bring that same commitment to our new Amazon Alexa skill, PURELL® Assistant, which will share our hand hygiene and sanitation know-how with new and long-time friends alike. Use this skill to find out more about our gentle, effective products and to hear tips for keeping your family healthy and well.

Disclaimer: The information in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.

name: MailHaven Package Tracker
description:
This skill requires users to have an account via the Mailhaven iOS app (see download link below).

Download the Mailhaven iOS app here 

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/mailhaven/id1189399189?ls=1&mt=8

Generally, a user will have packages being shipped to them and tracked on mailhaven app. This skill will allow users to ask mailhaven for information on their packages.

A user can ask for a status of all their undelivered packages. A user can also ask for the status of their last updated package (this package could be delivered, or in transit, etc...).

name: Lamps Plus Order Status
description:
Use Alexa to ask questions about all your Lamps Plus orders.  Get status updates or answers to other frequently asked questions anytime you like with the voice-activated convenience you love from Alexa.

We can help you locate a store near by where you can find our products.

To help you find a store quickly, we will need your device's location.  We will need your permission to access this information by having you enable GEO location on your device.  If GEO location is not available, we can also use the address assigned to your Alexa account with your permission.

We also have other ways to help you find a local store.  If the location information is not available from your device, we can use the address listed in your recent orders or we will ask you for your current location.

name: MyGroceryList
description:
PreRequisites:This app uses Twilio to send the list of items as text messages to any local phone number. But to use this functionality user must create their Twilio account and provide necessary permissions by visiting  https://mygrocerylist.fillearth.com. User can also complete the authorization process from the Privacy policy page (see link below)

Purpose: Often while going for grocery shopping we forget items that we  need to buy. With this skill, users can add items to the list whenever they find it missing. Then they can retrieve the list all at once just before going for shopping.
Features available: User can add an item, delete an item, retrieve all the items, check when an item is added and also clear the whole list. 
How it works: There is an "Items" table in DynamoDB. Whenever user adds an item it gets added to the list. Then when he deletes an item it gets deleted from the list. User can also clear the list at once. All these happens through Dialog.
review: When following the link Tom set up the Twillo account it requires a credit card the will initially charge it $10 and then subsequently keep the balance at $20 just to manage and text the grocery list!  Ummmmm no thank you!

name: BatteryBoot
description:
This skill will provide help and info for the Battery Boot which is a battery pack that was made to fit on your Echo.

Battery Boot Base for Amazon Echo

(c) Koozie LLC pat pend 62271525
review: Spam

name: Listonic - smart grocery list
description:
The Listonic skill improves the quality of your grocery shopping by making it easier, faster, and most importantly smarter. It is all you would want out of a shopping list app and more.

Plan your grocery shopping hands-free by dictating entire lists to Alexa. Listonic instantly syncs with Alexa giving you instant access to all your lists which you can then manage accordingly. What’s more, your lists can be shared with friends and family to make sure that everyone stays on top of what is needed. 

Listonic top-rated app helps millions of people around the world save time and money by smart planning and managing their groceries. 

This is how it works on Alexa:

First, you have to registrate a Listonic account on app.listonic.com or in our mobile app. 

Then you can:
- Add a new list with “Create list Joe’s Birthday Party”
- Add items to your list: "Add apple"
- Check and uncheck items with "Check/uncheck apple on Joe’s Birthday Party"
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “ Read list Joe’s Birthday Party”

To do multiple things consecutively start with:
- "Alexa, open Listonic."
After the welcome message continue with:
- "Change the default list to Joe’s Birthday Party."
- "What is on my list?"
- "Add 2 kilograms of apples to my list."

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
review: I've been using this on my iPhone for years, and was excited to see it come to Alexa... it integrates perfectly as a shopping list with seamless cross platform integration.

skills-rest: Prime Deal of the Day Flash Briefing
name: Prime Deal of the Day Flash Briefing
description:
Prime Deal of the Day Flash Briefing sends you the best prime deals each and every day right to your Alexa device!  We include how much time left on each deal so you will never miss out on the deepest discounts.

Updated constantly!

FEEDBACK
Email me at max@volleythat.com if you have any issues or feedback. We'd love to hear from you!
review: directs you to their website. doesnt tell you any info except to go to their website.

name: Edmunds
description:
Edmunds brings more than 50 years of automotive knowledge to your Alexa-enabled device with a  new way to access car shopping and ownership tools. Now, Alexa can help you shop for a car, appraise a vehicle, calculate cost of ownership, find out when your next service is due, and much more. 

Available topics: pros and cons, driving characteristics, safety, powertrain, warranty, fuel efficiency, seating capacity, length, width, height, price, cost, cargo capacity, headroom, curb weight, towing capacity, wheelbase, inventory, lease deals, dealers, recalls, maintenance, and true market value.
review: Speaking from someone in the car business. This skill is amazing and full of details about safety features power train info and specs of the motor for every vehicle I have asked about. Completely blown away.

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!
comment heading: Perfect for people who always forget their list
review: I love this app I don’t even use pen and paper anymore I just tell Alexa to open bring and add my items, it’s great.

description:
With Out of Milk, manage your shopping list with just your voice. Easily add or remove various products and sync your lists with family and friends. Out of Milk lets you keep track of all of your lists, and automatically syncs to your phone. Keep your pantry and your fridge fresh!


Our Features:

description:
Get today's deal on meh.com, that's pretty much it.

This is an unofficial Meh app, not affiliated with Meh.
comment heading: Great but please change app name to "Meh"
review:
Great - exactly what I was looking for, but please change it to "Meh" instead of "Meh Voice".
The second one is longer, unintuitive, etc.

Adding an option to read some of the details/options/etc, would be nice too! :)

name: Carter's Customer Service
description: Use Alexa to ask questions about all your  Carter's, OshKosh B'gosh or Skip Hop orders. Get status updates any time you like with the voice-activated convenience you love from Alexa.
comment heading: No se donde está mi pedido
review: Necesito averiguar donde está la orden

name: MailHaven Package Tracker
description:
This skill requires users to have an account via the Mailhaven iOS app (see download link below).

Download the Mailhaven iOS app here 

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/mailhaven/id1189399189?ls=1&mt=8

Generally, a user will have packages being shipped to them and tracked on mailhaven app. This skill will allow users to ask mailhaven for information on their packages.

A user can ask for a status of all their undelivered packages. A user can also ask for the status of their last updated package (this package could be delivered, or in transit, etc...).
comment heading: Makes tracking my packages so much easier
review: It saves me time and the hassle of tracking multiple packages. The Mailhaven skill is a game changer for sure, it’s beyond amazing!

name: Ingredients Guru
description:
Scared of allergies?
Want to know if a product contains an allergenic food?
Want to know if a product contains one or more of the major food allergens? 

Alexa will read it out for you.
Just ask Alexa by saying out the product name, or its UPC code, and Alexa will read out the ingredients for you. If the product contains some item that can cause allergic reaction, Alexa will mention it first, by saying "Interesting!". :)

You don't have to worry about reading out all the ingredients yourself, let the VUI save your day!

name: eBags
description: Use Alexa to ask questions about all youreBags orders. Get status updates any time you like with the voice-activated convenience you love from Alexa.
review: You have to invoke the skill to track eBags order otherwise it will default to amazon orders. Say “Alexa talk to eBags” first. Good skill

name: Ship.com — Automatic Package Tracker
description:
Ship.com keeps track of all your online orders, so you don't have to.

It starts with syncing the email you shop with to Ship.com. Ship.com finds your tracking numbers and gives you real-time updates on everything you order online, from retailers all over the internet.

Never miss a package again. You’ll receive notifications as your package makes its way to you, so you know exactly where it is and when you'll get it. Ship.com supports all major US carriers like Amazon, UPS, USPS, FedEx and more!

GET STARTED → Sign up on Ship.com or download the Ship.com iOS/Android app at http://ship.com

——

ALEXA

- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my stuff is"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my packages are"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com when my stuff is coming"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my next package is"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com when my last package arrived"

——

FEATURES

Automatic Tracking — don't bother looking for tracking numbers again. Ship.com finds them and magically syncs them into the app. (Works with Gmail, for now).
Real-Time Updates — notifications are sent to your phone, so you know where your packages are, and when you should be ready to be pick them up!
Privacy Matters — keeping your information private and secure is very important to us. We’ll never sell your personal data or emails.

——

HAVING ISSUES?

Ship.com is still in Beta and we would love to hear if you're running into issues or have any feedback for us. Email us at help@ship.com, reach out on twitter @ShipHQ or live chat with us on the Ship.com website.

Is there a specific order tracking code or email that Ship.com didn't pick up automatically? Forward your tracking email to track@ship.com and our experts will take a look!
review: This is a pretty useful skill. I’m surprised no one has done it yet. Track all your packages from one place. So easy. Their phone app is the same. I order a ton of stuff online so this makes my life a lot easier.

description:

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
review: I love the fact that there is integration. But it needs to utilize the other fields that are available like quantity. If I want 4 apples it adds the text Four Apples to my list rather than Apples with a quantity of 4. Plus it would be nice to be able to use any of my custom lists, which it cannot.

name: AnyList
description:

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
comment heading: Great start some needed improvements to make it 5 stars
review: I agree with many of the comments for improvement on here but the one not mentioned would be the ability to un-cross off items already on the shopping list, since I use one shopping list and will manually un-cross off items that we need when making the list for the next grocery visit. So if you could say, "Alexa, uncheck/un-cross off 'food item(s)' from my shopping list", then you could re-use the list each time to show only the items you need.

comment heading: Works great, but would love to customize
review: Alexa makes it incredibly easy to add items to AnyList, but it puts everything in an Alexa Shopping list. I'd really like the ability to add items to specific list(s). Five stars if we can do that!

name: 1-800-Flowers
description:
Send truly original and unique floral arrangements, plants and gifts in minutes with the 1-800-Flowers Skill. Simply enable Amazon Pay on your Alexa App, and you can start gifting with our 1-800-Flowers Skill! 

Find gifts for any occasion with ease by telling Alexa what type of gift you’re looking for (roses, sunflowers, gift baskets, chocolates, etc.) and Alexa will recommend one of our curated gifts from our Family of Brands for you to send. Not sure what gift you want to send? Simply tell Alexa who you would like to send a gift to (wife, mom, co-worker, grandparent, friend) and for what occasion (birthday, anniversary, graduation, sympathy, housewarming, holidays), and Alexa will recommend one of our truly original gifts. 

To complete the transaction, answer a few quick questions about the recipient’s delivery address and delivery date and pay with Amazon Pay. Your recipient will be receiving their gift with a smile shortly!

Meet Our Family of Brands:
[+] Cheryl’s Cookies
[+] FruitBouquets.com
[+] 1800Baskets.com
[+] Simply Chocolate
[+] Personalization Universe
[+] The Popcorn Factory
[+] Harry and David
[+] Wolferman’s
[+] Stock Yards
review: This skill made it super easy to order flowers.  The order was delivered to my Mom on the specified day before Mother's Day.  It was arranged by a local florist that delivered on 1-800-flowers behalf.

name: Buyhatke Assistant
description:
Buyhatke Assistant is on now Alexa. Currently, it offers two features.
1. Compare product prices: Say 'search iPhone 7s' or 'compare iPhone 7s prices' and it will give you prices of iPhone 7s on available e-commerce websites. Say 'more' to iterate through the list or say 'repeat' to hear the list again. 
2. Best deals on Flight: Either say 'book a flight' and let Alexa handle the rest or if you are in hurry say 'book a flight from Banglore to Delhi for tomorrow' and it will give you best flight deals available across all other available sites.
review: Explored the skill. The flight search intent works great.

name: Out Of Milk
description:
With Out of Milk, manage your shopping list with just your voice. Easily add or remove various products and sync your lists with family and friends. Out of Milk lets you keep track of all of your lists, and automatically syncs to your phone. Keep your pantry and your fridge fresh!

Wall Street Journal

'#1 of Top 25 Apps For Moms'
Babble 

'Top 10 Most-Used Shopping Apps'
Nielsen  

'How To Simplify your grocery shopping on Android'
CNET  

'Grocery List Apps That Make Shopping, Syncing Lists Simple'
Mashable
review:
This is the first cycle of the skill, and I am sure, if the developers at Out of Milk are as keen as the app developers, this skill will have more bells and whistles soon.

Right now, for those who wonder why to use it instead of the native Alexa skill is because you can move items between lists. So when you come home with your groceries, you can move them to your pantry list. That way, you don't have to wonder if you already have enough cans of tomato sauce.

What the skill needs:
1. It needs to pick up the categories the user has previously assigned items to. Of course, if it was never assigned one on the past, like if something is coming from the store deals tab, then it should remain uncategorized.
2. It should pick up price from previously entered items. This is invaluable to be and keeps me on target with my budget.
3. If it cannot do the above, the user could say "Add Milk Dairy $5.00"

What would be nice:
1. Ability to move things verbally from shopping list to pantry.
2. Search the list. "Alexa open Out of Milk. Is chicken on my shopping list? Do I have tomato sauce in my pantry list?"

I am giving four stars right now because I am expecting great things from the developers at Out of Milk. "A" for effort!

name: eBags
description: Use Alexa to ask questions about all youreBags orders. Get status updates any time you like with the voice-activated convenience you love from Alexa.
review: Worked great.  Nice to get updates on my eBags orders

name: My Deal
description:
We find hundreds of deals every day and can’t wait to share with you. We tailor deals that interests you.. Tell us which deals you like, as we get to know you better, we will target deals that fits your preferences.

You will receive a four-character personal code (such as“DEMO”), which you can use to review the detail of the deals that you liked at www.mydealweb.com.


How to use:

To launch:
     “ Alexa, open my deal. ”

To search for particular deals by keyword (For example: Amazon, iPhone, Women's Outerwear):
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of Amazon. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal what are the deals for iPhone. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal to tell me the deals for women's outerwear. ”

If you find deals you are interested in, like them by numbers and view the detail on your phone:
     “ one, two and four ”
     “ second and third ”
     “ first two ”
     “ last one ”

Or go to the next group:
     “ next ”

Or want to listen again:
     “ repeat ”

Of cause you can always get help by:
     “ help ”

Or exist any time by:
     “ Alexa, stop. ”


How did we grow up:

Mar-18-2017:

	Now we can search for deals by keyword! Just say: “Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of (Keyword).”

Mar-08-2017:

	Now we have a website “www.mydealweb.com”, where you can review the deals you liked with your personal code! 

Feb-28-2017:

	Your deals are not randomly selected any more. They are based on what you liked before!

Feb-18-2017:

	Choose the deals you like by the Deal Number, we will send the detail via the Alexa App!

Feb-08-2017:

	Now you can listen to the next group of deals by saying “Next” or the previous group of deals by saying “Repeat”, and get help any time by saying “Help”.

Jan-28-2017:

	Launched! With 5 deals every time.


We're always learning and building new features, and we can't do that well without your feedback. If you have comments, please share them with us at www.mydealweb.com/feedback.
review: very useful app. save my a lot of time to search deals.

name: My Grocer

name: Best Buy
description:
Get Best Buy's latest deals using only your voice. You can also search for products, track your order status, hear store hours and locations, and get answers to frequently asked questions.

For the best shopping experience, take a moment to link your Best Buy account. And to make ordering even easier, make sure you have a default credit card and shipping address stored at BestBuy.com. If while using our skill you choose to have a text sent with more information, Best Buy will need access to your Amazon account mobile number.  Go to the home screen in your Alexa app to grant permission.

Use the Best Buy skill to:
- Buy our latest deals, including special voice-only offers
- Search our product catalog
- Get updated order status information
- Locate a store near you
- Learn about Best Buy’s return policy, or get answers to other FAQs
- Ask for tech tips like, "how do I set a default printer" or "help me with my modem"
- Discover gift ideas or purchase Best Buy gift cards

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
review: I am so happy there is finally a skill to link to AnyList! While you can't use your own lists, I don't find it difficult to switch the list I use for my grocery shopping to the Alexa shopping list instead of mine.

name: shopper
description: Protein is the most expensive part of any meal, and you can save a lot of money buying it on sale. With this app you can say, "Alexa, ask meat seeker who is selling the cheapest chicken thighs", and it tell you where in Seattle to buy it and for how much. The weekly circular data from multiple local grocery stores is automatically collected via a backend web crawler into a database, which meat seeker uses to find the best bargains for you.

name: Purell
description:
PURELL® products are trusted and used in hospitals to help prevent the spread of infection. Now that same germ-fighting power is available for everyone - at home, at work and on the go. 

From innovative soap and sanitizer formulation, to breakthrough dispensing systems and portable solutions, the same commitment to well-being goes into every product we make.

We bring that same commitment to our new Amazon Alexa skill, PURELL® Assistant, which will share our hand hygiene and sanitation know-how with new and long-time friends alike. Use this skill to find out more about our gentle, effective products and to hear tips for keeping your family healthy and well.

Disclaimer: The information in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.

name: Produce Checker
description: PLU codes administered by the International Federation for Produce Standards (IFPS) are 4 or 5 digit identification numbers affixed to a produce in grocery stores The PLU number identifies produce items based upon various attributes which can include the commodity, the variety, the growing methodology (e.g. organic) and the size group. This skill helps you to find the details of a produce by asking its PLU code. All results are based on the data available on the IFPS website as on 7/6/2017
review: Excellent app

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!

name: Kit
description: Ask Kit to recommend products for your hobbies, gifts, or for getting things done.  Kit will find the best products and gear from top experts and influencers.
review: The recommendations are way off, I started asking for a computer and it heard me clearly but gave me a set of speakers. I then tried laptop and it gave me some high tech camera, and then I tried horse just to be smart and it gave me game of thrones themed coasters. Last I tried personal laptop computer thinking that's very specific and should get a more accurate result... it recommended a duffle bag. Within an hour I disabled this skill, maybe I'll try it again after some months pass and they work some bugs out

name: GiftJoy
description:
Welcome to GiftJoy - the new, convenient, and enjoyable way to instantly send eGift cards to family and friends! 

You can choose from over 100 top retailers such as Starbucks, Fandango, Sephora, Barnes & Noble, Applebee's, Domino's, Uber, Nordstrom, Target, Old Navy, Kohl's, and Nike.  

Simply tell Alexa your order by saying: 

"Alexa, open GiftJoy!" or "Alexa, ask GiftJoy to send a gift card."

Through voice, you'll be prompted for your order details such as your name, the recipient's name, the gift card brand and value, when you want the eGift card to be delivered, and your personalized greeting.  

You'll then get a text message with a link to review your order and enter your payment details.  So don't worry if you make a mistake, you'll be able to easily make edits in the next step. 

The recipient will get a text message (or email, if you prefer) with a link to the eGift card, which can be redeemed online or in-store.  PLUS: if they prefer a different brand, they can make a swap without any fees.  That means you'll always be sending the perfect gift!

After you've placed an order, you can ask for your order history.  "Alexa, ask GiftJoy for my order history."  You'll also get notified  (via email) when the recipient opens their gift. 

Happy Gifting!!

We'd love to hear about your GiftJoy experience: team@giftjoy.us
Our website: giftjoy.us
List of Retailers: giftjoy.us/retailers
review: Simple audio setup on Alexa and now it’s all setup it will be a breeze sending gift cards in the future!

review:
AnyList is my favorite app for grocery list. That said, I felt like Alexa integration was a missing feature. With this skill live, no other list app can touch AnyList. It's hands down the best.

My wife and I have a shared grocery list. Whenever anything is added or removed, it's synced to all our devices so whoever goes to the store has the most up to date list. Now whenever we are running low on something while cooking, we just tell Alexa right then and like magic its on our list ready to go. This is an absolute delight.

Great job AnyList!!

name: 1-800-Flowers
description:
Send truly original and unique floral arrangements, plants and gifts in minutes with the 1-800-Flowers Skill. Simply enable Amazon Pay on your Alexa App, and you can start gifting with our 1-800-Flowers Skill! 

Find gifts for any occasion with ease by telling Alexa what type of gift you’re looking for (roses, sunflowers, gift baskets, chocolates, etc.) and Alexa will recommend one of our curated gifts from our Family of Brands for you to send. Not sure what gift you want to send? Simply tell Alexa who you would like to send a gift to (wife, mom, co-worker, grandparent, friend) and for what occasion (birthday, anniversary, graduation, sympathy, housewarming, holidays), and Alexa will recommend one of our truly original gifts. 

To complete the transaction, answer a few quick questions about the recipient’s delivery address and delivery date and pay with Amazon Pay. Your recipient will be receiving their gift with a smile shortly!

Meet Our Family of Brands:
[+] Cheryl’s Cookies
[+] FruitBouquets.com
[+] 1800Baskets.com
[+] Simply Chocolate
[+] Personalization Universe
[+] The Popcorn Factory
[+] Harry and David
[+] Wolferman’s
[+] Stock Yards
