name: Ship.com — Automatic Package Tracker
description:
Ship.com keeps track of all your online orders, so you don't have to.

It starts with syncing the email you shop with to Ship.com. Ship.com finds your tracking numbers and gives you real-time updates on everything you order online, from retailers all over the internet.

Never miss a package again. You’ll receive notifications as your package makes its way to you, so you know exactly where it is and when you'll get it. Ship.com supports all major US carriers like Amazon, UPS, USPS, FedEx and more!

GET STARTED → Sign up on Ship.com or download the Ship.com iOS/Android app at http://ship.com

——

ALEXA

- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my stuff is"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my packages are"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com when my stuff is coming"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my next package is"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com when my last package arrived"

——

FEATURES

Automatic Tracking — don't bother looking for tracking numbers again. Ship.com finds them and magically syncs them into the app. (Works with Gmail, for now).
Real-Time Updates — notifications are sent to your phone, so you know where your packages are, and when you should be ready to be pick them up!
Privacy Matters — keeping your information private and secure is very important to us. We’ll never sell your personal data or emails.

——

HAVING ISSUES?

Ship.com is still in Beta and we would love to hear if you're running into issues or have any feedback for us. Email us at help@ship.com, reach out on twitter @ShipHQ or live chat with us on the Ship.com website.

Is there a specific order tracking code or email that Ship.com didn't pick up automatically? Forward your tracking email to track@ship.com and our experts will take a look!
comment heading: Cool skill for Echo Show being used in a household...
review: This is a really helpful skill for a household. I recommend creating a Ship.com account first and also note the email for Amazon and Ship.com need to be the same. You can add more emails once the account is created if you have orders coming to multiple email addresses. I hope that’s helpful to others!

name: REI Co-op
description:
The REI Co-op voice assistant allows Alexa to provide REI's Deal of the Day, REI store locations, equipment rental information, and up-to-date information on REI classes, events and garage sales.

REI is a national outdoor retail co-op dedicated to inspiring, educating, and outfitting its members and the community for a lifetime of outdoor adventure and stewardship.

To get started, enable the REI Co-op skill. Then just say:

"Alexa, ask REI about the Deal of the Day"
"Alexa, ask REI what garage sales are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what garage sales are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI to find stores near me"
"Alexa, ask REI to find stores near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what classes are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what classes are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what events are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what events are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what equipment can I rent near me"
"Alexa, ask REI what equipment can I rent near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI about the benefits of becoming an REI Co-op member"

Alternatively, you can start an interactive session by saying: "Alexa, start REI"
comment heading: This app may make you want to buy more non-Amazon stuff.
review: OK this app - like a lot of retail apps just informs you about things you cane easily find online. Given that REI does not sale anything on Amazon and the REI service is so good, it is good to the app and what it tells me. The deal of the day is like meh.com it is hard not to ask what it is and then buying

name: GiftJoy
description:
Welcome to GiftJoy - the new, convenient, and enjoyable way to instantly send eGift cards to family and friends! 

You can choose from over 100 top retailers such as Starbucks, Fandango, Sephora, Barnes & Noble, Applebee's, Domino's, Uber, Nordstrom, Target, Old Navy, Kohl's, and Nike.  

Simply tell Alexa your order by saying: 

"Alexa, open GiftJoy!" or "Alexa, ask GiftJoy to send a gift card."

Through voice, you'll be prompted for your order details such as your name, the recipient's name, the gift card brand and value, when you want the eGift card to be delivered, and your personalized greeting.  

You'll then get a text message with a link to review your order and enter your payment details.  So don't worry if you make a mistake, you'll be able to easily make edits in the next step. 

The recipient will get a text message (or email, if you prefer) with a link to the eGift card, which can be redeemed online or in-store.  PLUS: if they prefer a different brand, they can make a swap without any fees.  That means you'll always be sending the perfect gift!

After you've placed an order, you can ask for your order history.  "Alexa, ask GiftJoy for my order history."  You'll also get notified  (via email) when the recipient opens their gift. 

Happy Gifting!!

We'd love to hear about your GiftJoy experience: team@giftjoy.us
Our website: giftjoy.us
List of Retailers: giftjoy.us/retailers
review: The easiest way to send a gift card on the spot!  Its so easy to get any gift card of your choice, no more going through indivual websites and lengthy payment methods.

name: Mattress FIRM Tips
description:
Need help finding a mattress? Mattress FIRM Tips informs people about the best ways to buy a mattress and includes some of latest deals currently going on at participating locations.

Now, ask your device, "Alexa, open mattress firm tips"!
review: i agree. PLEASE add connectivity to the mattress firm m 900 app.

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
review: Perfect skill

name: Edmunds
description:
Edmunds brings more than 50 years of automotive knowledge to your Alexa-enabled device with a  new way to access car shopping and ownership tools. Now, Alexa can help you shop for a car, appraise a vehicle, calculate cost of ownership, find out when your next service is due, and much more. 

Available topics: pros and cons, driving characteristics, safety, powertrain, warranty, fuel efficiency, seating capacity, length, width, height, price, cost, cargo capacity, headroom, curb weight, towing capacity, wheelbase, inventory, lease deals, dealers, recalls, maintenance, and true market value.
review: Can't get it to work! What's so hard to understand about Ford Escape?

review: Anylist is amazing. I love the lists but adore the recipe features. I have every recipe stored in it. I can add any ingredient to my shopping list and add recipe to my calander. Just awesome.

name: Product Feedback
description: Product Feedback lets you give voice feedback on consumer products. This skill will capture opinions on and experience of mainstream brands in three categories. The categories include bodycare (e.g. Dove), haircare (e.g. Tresemme) and laundry (e.g. Comfort).
review: I would like to give you a bit of info that could improve your product a bit. If you could offer a feature that would allow a parent to contact their child. It would work as followed. Open your Alexa app and click on your hypothetical text Alexa’s microphone button. Then type your message you want to be spoken. I feel like it could come in handy for a few reasons.  Say your out of the house and your kid is home and won’t pick up the phone because they are ignoring you, their not hearing the phone, or their cell phone is dead. If I was able to send a text for Alexa to broadcast over the speaker(which I have control over with the apps volume control and there probably already using it to play their music while your out)they would hear it and call you back. Or maybe your just wanting to be funny at a gathering sending texts from another room for everyone to hear. Ether way I think it would be an easy option for you to add.

name: Out Of Milk
description:
With Out of Milk, manage your shopping list with just your voice. Easily add or remove various products and sync your lists with family and friends. Out of Milk lets you keep track of all of your lists, and automatically syncs to your phone. Keep your pantry and your fridge fresh!


Our Features:
-Easily create and edit your shopping lists
- Sync your shopping lists in real-time
- Quickly add and remove items on your lists

- Keep your lists synced from Alexa to your phone

You can always access your lists through our mobile apps and online on our website: http://www.outofmilk.com/.

name: Visit Wayne
description:
Welcome to Wayne County: The Gateway to Amish Country

The rural charm of Wayne County's rolling hills, lush woods, and scenic farmland is only the beginning of the offerings available to visitors and residents.

An abundance of cultural activities and events make Wayne County a great destination any time of the year. From the Ohio Light Opera's nationally recognized theater in the summer to the Wayne Center Ballet Company's Nutcracker in the winter, there is something to satisfy every taste year round.

Proudly designed and built in Wooster, Ohio, USA.

A Division of Vertex Software, Inc.
comment heading: Explore beautiful Wayne County, Ohio with just voice commands
review: Love it! Everything on their site is now available just for the asking. Events, food, hospitality and more!

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!
review:
I've been waiting for this feature for a long time. Finally it's here and so far, no problems.
I have the feeling if some reviewers read the whole description of the skill, their problems might resolve themselves.

review: The guys at AnyList must never sleep, because they continue to add useful things to an already great app.  Having AnyList on my Apple Watch is incredibly convenient....  Keep up the good work, guys!

description:

review: This skill is the very definition of Minimum Viable Product. It's functional, has no frills or customization options and it works reliably. The next step I think would be to allow people to specify a list, say "add milk to my walmart list," or "add protein shakes to my Costco list" instead of having all items go to a single "alexa" list. Like I titled this review, it's a good start and I appreciate having this ability without having to go through Apple reminders.

If you're in search of a store, a service or a bite to eat, you can now find it instantly by simply asking the Fashion Island Alexa Skill. Try it! Simply ask questions like, "Alexa, ask Fashion Island, where is Neiman Marcus located?" or " Alexa, ask Fashion Island, where I can valet?" or " Alexa, ask Fashion Island,  where are the restrooms?" and our IBM Watson-enhanced guest services experience will help you shop and navigate Fashion Island instantly. comment heading: Works well, but some tweaks are needed
review: Love the app itself.  I hope they can eventually "fix" the Alexa interaction so that it will understand ALL multi-word entries.  For example, I can ask to have "ice cream" or "olive oil" added, but if I ask to add "Coke Zero", it can't understand. Yet, it understands "Diet Coke".  I'm assuming there's a glossary of common items that Alexa is able to understand, and anything not on the list will result in failure.  It would be nice if Alexa app could see/understand items previously entered in the Out of Milk app and draw from that list as well as the global glossary.  Meaning, after I've manually added "Coke Zero" to my list, it should be recognized in the future by Alexa.

name: Ship.com — Automatic Package Tracker

Never miss a package again. You’ll receive notifications as your package makes its way to you, so you know exactly where it is and when you'll get it. Ship.com supports all major US carriers like Amazon, UPS, USPS, FedEx and more!

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.

name: MyGroceryList
description:
PreRequisites:This app uses Twilio to send the list of items as text messages to any local phone number. But to use this functionality user must create their Twilio account and provide necessary permissions by visiting  https://mygrocerylist.fillearth.com. User can also complete the authorization process from the Privacy policy page (see link below)

Purpose: Often while going for grocery shopping we forget items that we  need to buy. With this skill, users can add items to the list whenever they find it missing. Then they can retrieve the list all at once just before going for shopping.
Features available: User can add an item, delete an item, retrieve all the items, check when an item is added and also clear the whole list. 
How it works: There is an "Items" table in DynamoDB. Whenever user adds an item it gets added to the list. Then when he deletes an item it gets deleted from the list. User can also clear the list at once. All these happens through Dialog.
review: I don't know what the previous reviewer said, but there is no cost for this skill. Works as designed.

name: 1-800-Flowers
description:
Send truly original and unique floral arrangements, plants and gifts in minutes with the 1-800-Flowers Skill. Simply enable Amazon Pay on your Alexa App, and you can start gifting with our 1-800-Flowers Skill! 

Find gifts for any occasion with ease by telling Alexa what type of gift you’re looking for (roses, sunflowers, gift baskets, chocolates, etc.) and Alexa will recommend one of our curated gifts from our Family of Brands for you to send. Not sure what gift you want to send? Simply tell Alexa who you would like to send a gift to (wife, mom, co-worker, grandparent, friend) and for what occasion (birthday, anniversary, graduation, sympathy, housewarming, holidays), and Alexa will recommend one of our truly original gifts. 

To complete the transaction, answer a few quick questions about the recipient’s delivery address and delivery date and pay with Amazon Pay. Your recipient will be receiving their gift with a smile shortly!

Meet Our Family of Brands:
[+] Cheryl’s Cookies
[+] FruitBouquets.com
[+] 1800Baskets.com
[+] Simply Chocolate
[+] Personalization Universe
[+] The Popcorn Factory
[+] Harry and David
[+] Wolferman’s
[+] Stock Yards
review: Awesome! Will use this a TON!

review:
I’m trying to use your app over much more intuitive List apps. Your tutorials are horrible. They are visible inadequate.
It should be simple: You put an item on you list, you remove the item off your list once to have it, the item should then automatically go onto your history list.
What happens with this app: You put an item on your list, app automatically puts the item on the history list simultaneously so now it’s in two places, you remove the item off your list once you have it (by deleting or ‘putting in your cart’ whatever the heck you mean by that), either way you remove it, the item goes onto your history list, now you have two of everything you originally added to your list. This app does not work as advertised and is extremely frustrating.

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!
review: This app is very useful. Not only doesn't sync to my phone as well as Alexa but it syncs to my smart watch.

name: GiftJoy
description:
Welcome to GiftJoy - the new, convenient, and enjoyable way to instantly send eGift cards to family and friends! 

You can choose from over 100 top retailers such as Starbucks, Fandango, Sephora, Barnes & Noble, Applebee's, Domino's, Uber, Nordstrom, Target, Old Navy, Kohl's, and Nike.  

Simply tell Alexa your order by saying: 

"Alexa, open GiftJoy!" or "Alexa, ask GiftJoy to send a gift card."

Through voice, you'll be prompted for your order details such as your name, the recipient's name, the gift card brand and value, when you want the eGift card to be delivered, and your personalized greeting.  

You'll then get a text message with a link to review your order and enter your payment details.  So don't worry if you make a mistake, you'll be able to easily make edits in the next step. 

The recipient will get a text message (or email, if you prefer) with a link to the eGift card, which can be redeemed online or in-store.  PLUS: if they prefer a different brand, they can make a swap without any fees.  That means you'll always be sending the perfect gift!

After you've placed an order, you can ask for your order history.  "Alexa, ask GiftJoy for my order history."  You'll also get notified  (via email) when the recipient opens their gift. 

Happy Gifting!!

We'd love to hear about your GiftJoy experience: team@giftjoy.us
Our website: giftjoy.us
List of Retailers: giftjoy.us/retailers
review: Why set a reminder to get a gift card, when you could actually send a card!

name: Best Buy
description:
Get Best Buy's latest deals using only your voice. You can also search for products, track your order status, hear store hours and locations, and get answers to frequently asked questions.

For the best shopping experience, take a moment to link your Best Buy account. And to make ordering even easier, make sure you have a default credit card and shipping address stored at BestBuy.com. If while using our skill you choose to have a text sent with more information, Best Buy will need access to your Amazon account mobile number.  Go to the home screen in your Alexa app to grant permission.

Use the Best Buy skill to:
- Buy our latest deals, including special voice-only offers
- Search our product catalog
- Get updated order status information
- Locate a store near you
- Learn about Best Buy’s return policy, or get answers to other FAQs
- Ask for tech tips like, "how do I set a default printer" or "help me with my modem"
- Discover gift ideas or purchase Best Buy gift cards

name: GiftJoy
description:
Welcome to GiftJoy - the new, convenient, and enjoyable way to instantly send eGift cards to family and friends! 

You can choose from over 100 top retailers such as Starbucks, Fandango, Sephora, Barnes & Noble, Applebee's, Domino's, Uber, Nordstrom, Target, Old Navy, Kohl's, and Nike.  

Simply tell Alexa your order by saying: 

"Alexa, open GiftJoy!" or "Alexa, ask GiftJoy to send a gift card."

Through voice, you'll be prompted for your order details such as your name, the recipient's name, the gift card brand and value, when you want the eGift card to be delivered, and your personalized greeting.  

You'll then get a text message with a link to review your order and enter your payment details.  So don't worry if you make a mistake, you'll be able to easily make edits in the next step. 

The recipient will get a text message (or email, if you prefer) with a link to the eGift card, which can be redeemed online or in-store.  PLUS: if they prefer a different brand, they can make a swap without any fees.  That means you'll always be sending the perfect gift!

After you've placed an order, you can ask for your order history.  "Alexa, ask GiftJoy for my order history."  You'll also get notified  (via email) when the recipient opens their gift. 

Happy Gifting!!

We'd love to hear about your GiftJoy experience: team@giftjoy.us
Our website: giftjoy.us
List of Retailers: giftjoy.us/retailers
review: Using giftjoy was so incredibly easy!!!! I highly recommend it!

name: Woot Monkeys
description: Every day Woot has a new monkey chat which you can easily check by asking Alexa.
review: New monkey chat, daily

name: My Deal
description:
We find hundreds of deals every day and can’t wait to share with you. We tailor deals that interests you.. Tell us which deals you like, as we get to know you better, we will target deals that fits your preferences.

You will receive a four-character personal code (such as“DEMO”), which you can use to review the detail of the deals that you liked at www.mydealweb.com.


How to use:

To launch:
     “ Alexa, open my deal. ”

To search for particular deals by keyword (For example: Amazon, iPhone, Women's Outerwear):
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of Amazon. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal what are the deals for iPhone. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal to tell me the deals for women's outerwear. ”

If you find deals you are interested in, like them by numbers and view the detail on your phone:
     “ one, two and four ”
     “ second and third ”
     “ first two ”
     “ last one ”

Or go to the next group:
     “ next ”

Or want to listen again:
     “ repeat ”

Of cause you can always get help by:
     “ help ”

Or exist any time by:
     “ Alexa, stop. ”


How did we grow up:

Mar-18-2017:

	Now we can search for deals by keyword! Just say: “Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of (Keyword).”

Mar-08-2017:

	Now we have a website “www.mydealweb.com”, where you can review the deals you liked with your personal code! 

Feb-28-2017:

	Your deals are not randomly selected any more. They are based on what you liked before!

Feb-18-2017:

	Choose the deals you like by the Deal Number, we will send the detail via the Alexa App!

Feb-08-2017:

	Now you can listen to the next group of deals by saying “Next” or the previous group of deals by saying “Repeat”, and get help any time by saying “Help”.

Jan-28-2017:

	Launched! With 5 deals every time.


We're always learning and building new features, and we can't do that well without your feedback. If you have comments, please share them with us at www.mydealweb.com/feedback.

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!

name: Food Tracker
description:
Food Tracker can keep track of the expiration dates of food. You can add and remove items from Food Tracker and ask Food Tracker when items expire. This skill is best used as you are putting away your groceries after going to the store.


To start, add an item with an expiration date, you could say:

"Alexa, create expiration date for [item] on [date] using Food Tracker"

The same item cannot be added twice to the list.


You can do the following things with Food Tracker:
- Add expiration dates for items
"Alexa, add expiration date for [item] on [date] using Food Tracker"
- Check if an item is in the list
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker is [item] in my list"
- Get expiration dates for items
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker, when does [item] expire"
- Get how long before items expire
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker, how long before [item] expires"
- Check if an item has expired
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker has [item] expired" 
- Get number of expired items
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker how many items have expired"
- Get list of expired items
"Alexa, get all expired items from Food Tracker"
- Get the next expiring item
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker what item is expiring next"
- Get a list of all items
"Alexa, get all items from Food Tracker"
- Get number of all items
"Alexa, ask Food Tracker how many items are in my list"
- Delete an item
"Alexa, remove [item] from Food Tracker"
- Delete all expired items
"Alexa, delete all expired items from Food Tracker"
- Delete all items (BE CAREFUL!)
"Alexa, delete all items in my list from Food Tracker"

Slight variations of the above commands will also work.

NOTE: Disabling and enabling the Food Tracker skill will delete all items in your list.

Additional functionality will be added over time.

Icon made by Madebyoliver (https://www.flaticon.com/authors/madebyoliver) from www.flaticon.com

name: Listonic - smart grocery list
description:
The Listonic skill improves the quality of your grocery shopping by making it easier, faster, and most importantly smarter. It is all you would want out of a shopping list app and more.

Plan your grocery shopping hands-free by dictating entire lists to Alexa. Listonic instantly syncs with Alexa giving you instant access to all your lists which you can then manage accordingly. What’s more, your lists can be shared with friends and family to make sure that everyone stays on top of what is needed. 

Listonic top-rated app helps millions of people around the world save time and money by smart planning and managing their groceries. 

This is how it works on Alexa:

First, you have to registrate a Listonic account on app.listonic.com or in our mobile app. 

Then you can:
- Add a new list with “Create list Joe’s Birthday Party”
- Add items to your list: "Add apple"
- Check and uncheck items with "Check/uncheck apple on Joe’s Birthday Party"
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “ Read list Joe’s Birthday Party”

To do multiple things consecutively start with:
- "Alexa, open Listonic."
After the welcome message continue with:
- "Change the default list to Joe’s Birthday Party."
- "What is on my list?"
- "Add 2 kilograms of apples to my list."
review: It will only add items to "Alexa List". If you change the name of the list to "Grocery" for example , Alexa will create a new "Alexa List"" and add items to that. You can't create or change active lists with Alexa .  Even using the app on my phone is disappointing. It's too hard to get it to sort your items by how your favorite grocery store is laid out. I inadvertently "delete purchased items" trying to get it to custom sort. Once they're deleted, you can't restore them, not even from the trash in settings. I really like the "Color Note" app, just wish it had a link with Alexa.

name: 1-800-Flowers
description:
Send truly original and unique floral arrangements, plants and gifts in minutes with the 1-800-Flowers Skill. Simply enable Amazon Pay on your Alexa App, and you can start gifting with our 1-800-Flowers Skill! 

Find gifts for any occasion with ease by telling Alexa what type of gift you’re looking for (roses, sunflowers, gift baskets, chocolates, etc.) and Alexa will recommend one of our curated gifts from our Family of Brands for you to send. Not sure what gift you want to send? Simply tell Alexa who you would like to send a gift to (wife, mom, co-worker, grandparent, friend) and for what occasion (birthday, anniversary, graduation, sympathy, housewarming, holidays), and Alexa will recommend one of our truly original gifts. 

To complete the transaction, answer a few quick questions about the recipient’s delivery address and delivery date and pay with Amazon Pay. Your recipient will be receiving their gift with a smile shortly!

name: Purell
description:
PURELL® products are trusted and used in hospitals to help prevent the spread of infection. Now that same germ-fighting power is available for everyone - at home, at work and on the go. 

From innovative soap and sanitizer formulation, to breakthrough dispensing systems and portable solutions, the same commitment to well-being goes into every product we make.

We bring that same commitment to our new Amazon Alexa skill, PURELL® Assistant, which will share our hand hygiene and sanitation know-how with new and long-time friends alike. Use this skill to find out more about our gentle, effective products and to hear tips for keeping your family healthy and well.

Disclaimer: The information in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.

name: MyGroceryList
description:
PreRequisites:This app uses Twilio to send the list of items as text messages to any local phone number. But to use this functionality user must create their Twilio account and provide necessary permissions by visiting  https://mygrocerylist.fillearth.com. User can also complete the authorization process from the Privacy policy page (see link below)

Purpose: Often while going for grocery shopping we forget items that we  need to buy. With this skill, users can add items to the list whenever they find it missing. Then they can retrieve the list all at once just before going for shopping.
Features available: User can add an item, delete an item, retrieve all the items, check when an item is added and also clear the whole list. 
How it works: There is an "Items" table in DynamoDB. Whenever user adds an item it gets added to the list. Then when he deletes an item it gets deleted from the list. User can also clear the list at once. All these happens through Dialog.

name: Zen Buggy
description:
The Zen Buggy skill allows users with an active account on zenbuggy.com to add items to their grocery list via voice control.

What makes Zen Buggy different is that, as you are shopping, you can mark the aisle locations of the items on your list and then check them off as you add them to your cart. Then, the next time you add those items to your list, they will automatically show up on the correct aisle. Aso, items tagged by other shoppers at the same store will show up as well, but you can easily change the location(s) if items have moved, etc...

Zen Buggy also supports multiple stores, and you can easily move items between them. Items moved will always show up on the correct aisle, as long as they have previously been tagged by you or another shopper.

Pro tip: Use the word "And" between items to add multiple items to your list. Zen Buggy looks for that word and uses it to separate your sentence into distinct items. For instance, saying "Add Peanut Butter and Grape Jelly" would show up as two separate line items. Try it!

review: I've once had the Skill delete my entire shopping list but it has mostly worked fine. NOTE: the skill only works with US ENGLISH. If you change your Echo's language to anything else, it will stop working. I found this out the hard way and had to contact support to figure it out even though it does list the supported languages in the Skill's information page.

name: AisleWise
description:
The Alexa Aisle Wise skill lets you add items or recipes to your AisleWise grocery shopping list.  

You must have an existing AisleWise account to use this skill from Alexa. If you do not have an account, simply visit AisleWise.com and sign up.  

Once you have an account, you can add any item to your AisleWise shopping list with a simple command.  You can also add recipes to your shopping list, but the recipe must first exist in your personal AisleWise recipes collection. 

Note about recipes: when you first create a recipe, you segregate recipe items into ingredients (items not normally in your refrigerator or pantry) and staples (items normally in your refrigerator or pantry). When you tell AisleWise to add a recipe to your list using Alexa, ingredients only are added.
comment heading: So much better than default shopping list!
review: Still in development, but works great to add AND sort your grocery items by the proper aisle to make shopping easier!

name: Meh Stalker
description:
Meh Stalker is a tool used to quickly see what is being sold by meh.com.  Users can get the current sale details, or details from any sale from the launch date of meh.com.  

In addition to deal information, users can retrieve the current poll and options, ask when the last fuku was sold, find out who the goat is, and even ask "what went wrong".

Meh Stalker is not endorsed or affiliated with Meh.com or Medicore Labs

name: Redbox
description: The Redbox Alexa skill allows you discover what new release movies and games are available at your local Redbox kiosks.  You can ask about specific titles, or what is new this week.  You can also learn about the plot, the rating, and who stars in a movie.
comment heading: Redbox streaming, Firestick no but Roku stick yes
review: Very disappointed that my new Firestick with Alexa remote won't run Redbox on demand movies. Thankfully, my other TV which has an older Roku stick can play the movies!  Will definitely keep in mind for recommendations and future purchases!

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
comment heading: Ta-da!  AnyList and Alexa now supprt all you list names . . .
review: It now supports using any named list from all of your list on AnyList.  For example you can say "Alexa, add cookies to the Shared Grocery List" and ta-da - cookies show up on the Shared Grocery List on my phone and my wife's phone.  You can also be brief just saying "Alexa, add apples to grocery list" and it adds them to the list titled "Shared Grocery List".

review: Says that I am using wrong list when I only have 1 list. Then it deletes all items no matter what I say

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!
review: Saying, : "Alexa, open Bring" or "Alexa, open Bring app" does nothing.  Also, it's not possible to add an item to a specific list, only to default list.

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
comment heading: The best for Lists with Alexa and Iphone integration !
review: This skill is great! This solves the problem of having lists with Alexa be completely useful because I can now integrate perfectly with an app on my phone to add items and even use siri to add items from my phone. So cool that someone made this happen! It has been completely reliable with regular use.

name: Who's next
description: Next time you're trying to decide whose turn it is pick something or perform a task, just ask Alexa for help. For example, if you're trying to decide whose turn it is to pick a movie on movie night, Alexa can randomly select someone's name from the list. Or if you're trying to decide who should take out the trash, Alexa can help with that too!
comment heading: ok so it doesn't really work
review: i said open who's next and it said a random name (Cindy) and you have no way to control the names of who is in your home.

name: Mattress FIRM Tips
description:
Need help finding a mattress? Mattress FIRM Tips informs people about the best ways to buy a mattress and includes some of latest deals currently going on at participating locations.

Now, ask your device, "Alexa, open mattress firm tips"!

name: GiftJoy
description:
Welcome to GiftJoy - the new, convenient, and enjoyable way to instantly send eGift cards to family and friends! 

You can choose from over 100 top retailers such as Starbucks, Fandango, Sephora, Barnes & Noble, Applebee's, Domino's, Uber, Nordstrom, Target, Old Navy, Kohl's, and Nike.  

Simply tell Alexa your order by saying: 

"Alexa, open GiftJoy!" or "Alexa, ask GiftJoy to send a gift card."

Through voice, you'll be prompted for your order details such as your name, the recipient's name, the gift card brand and value, when you want the eGift card to be delivered, and your personalized greeting.  

You'll then get a text message with a link to review your order and enter your payment details.  So don't worry if you make a mistake, you'll be able to easily make edits in the next step. 

The recipient will get a text message (or email, if you prefer) with a link to the eGift card, which can be redeemed online or in-store.  PLUS: if they prefer a different brand, they can make a swap without any fees.  That means you'll always be sending the perfect gift!

After you've placed an order, you can ask for your order history.  "Alexa, ask GiftJoy for my order history."  You'll also get notified  (via email) when the recipient opens their gift. 

Happy Gifting!!

We'd love to hear about your GiftJoy experience: team@giftjoy.us
Our website: giftjoy.us
List of Retailers: giftjoy.us/retailers
review:
This was easy, and dare I say fun, to set up and use - my Alexa wasn't  hearing me too well and my roommate videoed me while I was doing it and caught some funny facial expressions and me over enunciating.

10/10 will use again - I look forward to more retailers being added!

name: Best Buy
description:
Get Best Buy's latest deals using only your voice. You can also search for products, track your order status, hear store hours and locations, and get answers to frequently asked questions.

For the best shopping experience, take a moment to link your Best Buy account. And to make ordering even easier, make sure you have a default credit card and shipping address stored at BestBuy.com. If while using our skill you choose to have a text sent with more information, Best Buy will need access to your Amazon account mobile number.  Go to the home screen in your Alexa app to grant permission.

Use the Best Buy skill to:
- Buy our latest deals, including special voice-only offers
- Search our product catalog
- Get updated order status information
- Locate a store near you
- Learn about Best Buy’s return policy, or get answers to other FAQs
- Ask for tech tips like, "how do I set a default printer" or "help me with my modem"
- Discover gift ideas or purchase Best Buy gift cards
comment heading: Easy to use - great way to find deals!
review: Really easy to use skill and I love how it gives me the opportunity to see deals from Best Buy. Very forward thinking on Amazon's part.

name: B&H Photo Deal Zone
description: Your Echo (or other Alexa-compatible device) can now tell you B&H's daily deal! Just say "Alexa, ask b h photo video for today's deal" and you'll hear the main deal along with it's price, savings and other info.
comment heading: Mixed feelings. Good prices. Don't always ship timely. Too many holiday breaks.
review: My feelings on B&H are mixed. They have good prices. Quick delivery, most of the time. BUT, they are closed for a LOT of holidays and sometimes, like now, they hold an order because of one back ordered item. I need the order. I went to their site to check why I hadn't gotten it and found this out. But now they are closed for another holiday so I can't do anything about it. Pain in the butt.

name: Bloomingdale's
description:
This Bloomingdale's skill lets you find store locations, check events at your local store, find coupons and deals, and search for products.

- You can ask for nearby store locations
- You can check for store hours
- You can check for events at your local store
- You can ask for coupons and deals
- You can search for products
review: Using my Alexa to shop at Bloomingdales was so easy and convenient! I asked Bloomingdales for recommendations for a black dresses for a wedding and I loved all of the suggestions! What a great idea and way to shop! I was able to multi-task in the kitchen while cooking dinner and find a new dress.....what could be better than that!?

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
review: I have been waiting a long time for this skill and it was worth the wait! Now I can tell Alexa to add items to my AnyList and it gets added almost immediately. Before this new skill was available, I had to use IFTTT to add items to AnyList which was very kludgy at best.

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
review:
I use Anylist as my only organizer!  I manage tons of projects which means a lot of lists.  Over 600 to do items at any given time.  This skill has helped me when a brain storm hits, to be able to add it to the appropriate list right away, from wherever I am in my home office.  With an Alexa enabled sevice of
course.  Only thing missing is, Anylist does not have a feature yet (I’ve suggested multiple times) that will allow the list to be sorted by the order in which you dictate them.  I want the last entered item at the top of the list.  The only options now is alphabetical or it puts the item at the bottom.  Then you have to drag it to the top or where you want it.

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
comment heading: Troubleshooting for the Use of Existing Lists
review: In order for Alexa to use lists you have previously made/used on AnyList, you need to go into your AnyList app, go to the list you want to use, click the settings "gear" symbol, and slide the button saying "Sync with Amazon Alexa", allowing Alexa to have access to it. Easy and awesome!

review: I cannot get it right. I have an iPhone that I tell Siri to add things to Any List and it works great. However, trying to add Alexa in the family is not working well. I can turn it all on but it creates an Alexa Shopping List. I want it to sync to the “Shopping List” I already have. When I tell Alexa to add something it adds it to the default Alexa Shopping list but not to my Anylist Shopping list. I cannot figure it out.

name: BatteryBoot
description:
This skill will provide help and info for the Battery Boot which is a battery pack that was made to fit on your Echo.

Battery Boot Base for Amazon Echo

(c) Koozie LLC pat pend 62271525
review: This "skill" is just spam.  A free ad.

name: Listonic - smart grocery list
description:
The Listonic skill improves the quality of your grocery shopping by making it easier, faster, and most importantly smarter. It is all you would want out of a shopping list app and more.

Plan your grocery shopping hands-free by dictating entire lists to Alexa. Listonic instantly syncs with Alexa giving you instant access to all your lists which you can then manage accordingly. What’s more, your lists can be shared with friends and family to make sure that everyone stays on top of what is needed. 

Listonic top-rated app helps millions of people around the world save time and money by smart planning and managing their groceries. 

This is how it works on Alexa:

First, you have to registrate a Listonic account on app.listonic.com or in our mobile app. 

Then you can:
- Add a new list with “Create list Joe’s Birthday Party”
- Add items to your list: "Add apple"
- Check and uncheck items with "Check/uncheck apple on Joe’s Birthday Party"
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “ Read list Joe’s Birthday Party”

To do multiple things consecutively start with:
- "Alexa, open Listonic."
After the welcome message continue with:
- "Change the default list to Joe’s Birthday Party."
- "What is on my list?"
- "Add 2 kilograms of apples to my list."
review: would be nice to have a list of commands

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
comment heading: Please Add Ability to Access Recipies!
review: My husband and I have been using Anylist for years.  We love that we can tell Alexa to add to our grocery list, but the failure to allow Alexa Show to access and display our recipes really has us bummed.  We bought the Show primarily to display our own recipes while cooking, and it was a big let down when we discovered our favorite app doesn't integrate.  It would be a total pain to try to move dozens of recipes to an app with this feature.  We'd love to stay with Anylist.  Please add this feature!

skills-rest: Deal of the Day Flash Briefing
name: Deal of the Day Flash Briefing
description: Find new products and ways to save every day by adding the Deal of the Day Flash Briefing to your life.

name: Visit Wayne
description:
Welcome to Wayne County: The Gateway to Amish Country

The rural charm of Wayne County's rolling hills, lush woods, and scenic farmland is only the beginning of the offerings available to visitors and residents.

An abundance of cultural activities and events make Wayne County a great destination any time of the year. From the Ohio Light Opera's nationally recognized theater in the summer to the Wayne Center Ballet Company's Nutcracker in the winter, there is something to satisfy every taste year round.

Proudly designed and built in Wooster, Ohio, USA.
(c)Copyright 2018 Agile Audio Dashboards
A Division of Vertex Software, Inc.

review: Would be better if I didn’t have to say Alexa for every single item to add to my grocery list. It’s annoying and almost makes it not worth it. Why not “Alexa, let’s add multiple items to my grocery list” then you speak and keep adding. Then if no sound for 5-10 seconds Alexa asks if you’re done or you tell “Alexa, that is all” and that ends it. I ask Alexa to read my whole grocery list and she tells me the total items and the 5 most recently added then asks if I want to hear the rest. Smh.

name: REI Co-op
description:
The REI Co-op voice assistant allows Alexa to provide REI's Deal of the Day, REI store locations, equipment rental information, and up-to-date information on REI classes, events and garage sales.

REI is a national outdoor retail co-op dedicated to inspiring, educating, and outfitting its members and the community for a lifetime of outdoor adventure and stewardship.

To get started, enable the REI Co-op skill. Then just say:

"Alexa, ask REI about the Deal of the Day"
"Alexa, ask REI what garage sales are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what garage sales are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI to find stores near me"
"Alexa, ask REI to find stores near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what classes are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what classes are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what events are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what events are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what equipment can I rent near me"
"Alexa, ask REI what equipment can I rent near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI about the benefits of becoming an REI Co-op member"

Alternatively, you can start an interactive session by saying: "Alexa, start REI"
review: Never works

name: Woot
description: This skill allows you to quickly and easily learn about Woot's daily deals on any of the Woot categories. To get started, you just have to ask Woot for the daily deal. You can also get more specific by asking about deals in a particular category such as shirt deal.
review: Could not get to recognize commands, even shows in history as recognizing 'woot'

name: Produce Checker
description: PLU codes administered by the International Federation for Produce Standards (IFPS) are 4 or 5 digit identification numbers affixed to a produce in grocery stores The PLU number identifies produce items based upon various attributes which can include the commodity, the variety, the growing methodology (e.g. organic) and the size group. This skill helps you to find the details of a produce by asking its PLU code. All results are based on the data available on the IFPS website as on 7/6/2017

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!
review:
The negative reviews here seem to be from people that don't know how to use it. Some probably didn't authenticate the app, others didn't read the instructions.  Such as adding items to a different list:
• "Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.” "

I use a Wear OS watch and can add things from it, add things from my phone, my wife can add things from her phone, both of us can add things from our Alexa devices (and she has one at her office). This really helps us to remember shopping and todo things, when we remember something, we can always add it immediately.

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
review: If you add something to your list that is already checked off, it just adds a second copy rather than resetting the existing item. Too bad because otherwise this would have been great.

name: Stupid Deal
description: Simple skill that will read the Stupid Deal of the Day from musiciansfriend.com
review: Stupidist deal I have found!  This skil needs to go away!

name: publix chicken tender subs
description:
Lets you know if chicken tenders subs are on sale at publix this week.

pulls date from arepublixchickentendersubsonsale.com

thanks to /u/rustylikeafox for keeping the site up to date

name: Ingredients Guru
description:
Scared of allergies?
Want to know if a product contains an allergenic food?
Want to know if a product contains one or more of the major food allergens? 

Alexa will read it out for you.
Just ask Alexa by saying out the product name, or its UPC code, and Alexa will read out the ingredients for you. If the product contains some item that can cause allergic reaction, Alexa will mention it first, by saying "Interesting!". :)

You don't have to worry about reading out all the ingredients yourself, let the VUI save your day!
review: Ask for crunchy peanut butter and you get some peanut butter cereal. Ask for milk and you get a chocolate milk beverage ingredient list. It found Welch's fruit snacks but this app needs a lot of work and better and more specific recognition.

name: eBags
description: Use Alexa to ask questions about all youreBags orders. Get status updates any time you like with the voice-activated convenience you love from Alexa.
review: I was so ecstatic that I was able to use the discount for my snowboard bag. It is the best price for that bag on the internet, period.

review: Works flawlessly. Whenever I randomly think of an item I need to pick up at the store I simply ask Alexia to add it to my shopping list. Couldn't be simpler. Now whenever I'm at the store I just pull out my phone and for once I got everything. Great skill!

name: Best Buy
description:
Get Best Buy's latest deals using only your voice. You can also search for products, track your order status, hear store hours and locations, and get answers to frequently asked questions.

For the best shopping experience, take a moment to link your Best Buy account. And to make ordering even easier, make sure you have a default credit card and shipping address stored at BestBuy.com. If while using our skill you choose to have a text sent with more information, Best Buy will need access to your Amazon account mobile number.  Go to the home screen in your Alexa app to grant permission.

Use the Best Buy skill to:
- Buy our latest deals, including special voice-only offers
- Search our product catalog
- Get updated order status information
- Locate a store near you
- Learn about Best Buy’s return policy, or get answers to other FAQs
- Ask for tech tips like, "how do I set a default printer" or "help me with my modem"
- Discover gift ideas or purchase Best Buy gift cards
review: Pretty cool

comment heading: I REALLY do not want it to do anything with the Alexa Shopping or ToDo List
review: There are already plenty of ways to sync my Anylist to the Alexa Shopping list.  Plenty of IFTTT skills to pull that off.  I want direct access to shopping lists completely bypassing the Amazon stuff.  I should be able to say "Alexa, tell AnyList to add toilet paper to my Grocery Store shopping list." and "Alexa, tell AnyList to add underwear to my Walmart shopping list."

name: Macy's Orders
description:
This skill allows users to track their orders through the Alexa App and Echo. To use this skill, follow these instructions:
1- Subscribe to link your package to your Alexa account through the tracking page sent to you by Macy's.
2- Interact with your Alexa enabled device by asking one of the following questions, Alexa, ask Macy's Orders where is my package or Alexa, ask Macy's Orders to track package
review: Its works great on Alexa.

name: 1-800-Flowers
description:
Send truly original and unique floral arrangements, plants and gifts in minutes with the 1-800-Flowers Skill. Simply enable Amazon Pay on your Alexa App, and you can start gifting with our 1-800-Flowers Skill! 

Find gifts for any occasion with ease by telling Alexa what type of gift you’re looking for (roses, sunflowers, gift baskets, chocolates, etc.) and Alexa will recommend one of our curated gifts from our Family of Brands for you to send. Not sure what gift you want to send? Simply tell Alexa who you would like to send a gift to (wife, mom, co-worker, grandparent, friend) and for what occasion (birthday, anniversary, graduation, sympathy, housewarming, holidays), and Alexa will recommend one of our truly original gifts. 

To complete the transaction, answer a few quick questions about the recipient’s delivery address and delivery date and pay with Amazon Pay. Your recipient will be receiving their gift with a smile shortly!

Meet Our Family of Brands:
[+] Cheryl’s Cookies
[+] FruitBouquets.com
[+] 1800Baskets.com
[+] Simply Chocolate
[+] Personalization Universe
[+] The Popcorn Factory
[+] Harry and David
[+] Wolferman’s
[+] Stock Yards
review: This is so cool. Just sent my wife flowers for our anniversary. Was typing emails for work as I did it! Best way to multi task

Toyota and its logos are trademarks of Toyota Motor Corporation.

Ok well its very exciting to have this tablet and I am very greatful to be able to do all this stuff. I like Alexa I give a five star cause shes very smart.

name: Visit Wayne
description:
Welcome to Wayne County: The Gateway to Amish Country

The rural charm of Wayne County's rolling hills, lush woods, and scenic farmland is only the beginning of the offerings available to visitors and residents.

An abundance of cultural activities and events make Wayne County a great destination any time of the year. From the Ohio Light Opera's nationally recognized theater in the summer to the Wayne Center Ballet Company's Nutcracker in the winter, there is something to satisfy every taste year round.

Proudly designed and built in Wooster, Ohio, USA.
(c)Copyright 2018 Agile Audio Dashboards
A Division of Vertex Software, Inc.
comment heading: The "Go To" for Wayne County events!!
review: This couldn't be easier -- just ask for the current events, and you'll hear exactly what is going on in Wayne County for the upcoming weeks and month.  Each event is numbered, and describes the who/what/where/when of the events -- perfect for knowing what's going on around Wayne County.  Love it!!

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
comment heading: Use either Google Home or Alexa. Also use multiple lists with both.
review:
One of my favorite apps. Been using it for years.  For those that use iPhones and Alexa, You can use it for multiplayer lists.  Just make as many lists in iPhone Reminders, then turn settings in Anylist to “Export from Reminder” and make sure “Amazon Alexa” turned on.  Of course, make sure you’re AnyList is on Alexa skill.  Viola.  You can ask Alexa to add any items to any list, like “Add Milk and Cereal to Grocery List” and “Add Detergent to Costco List.”  (And yes, Alexa allows you to now add multiple items at once).

And if you have Google Home, just use IFTT and make a new applet with recipe phrase “Add $ to XXXX List” for each list you want, like Target, grocery, Costco, pet store, etc.  Also make sure to link Google Assistant in IFTTT App.

I prefer Alexa better since it’s smart enough to know if you already have an item on your list, and it can remove items.  Google home is a bit more limited at the moment.

name: Send Me a Sample
description:
Whenever you see a brand featuring the Send Me a Sample logo, just say “Alexa, ask Send Me a Sample” and your product sample of choice will be delivered straight to your door, completely free.  
______________
 
Send Me a Sample is the voice destination for the latest brand samples. Make sure to check out sendmeasample.net or our Facebook page to find out what samples are currently available. 
______________

To get started, create and link your Send Me a Sample account. You’ll only need to do this once and we’ll only send you the samples and vouchers that you’ve asked for. 
______________

Any problems? Get in touch with the team at hello@sendmeasample.net. Please allow 14 days for your samples to arrive.
review: literally just got an add for free sample of butterfinger then went through it and it said they were out of stop - stop running the ads on youtube then

name: Listonic - smart grocery list
description:
The Listonic skill improves the quality of your grocery shopping by making it easier, faster, and most importantly smarter. It is all you would want out of a shopping list app and more.

Plan your grocery shopping hands-free by dictating entire lists to Alexa. Listonic instantly syncs with Alexa giving you instant access to all your lists which you can then manage accordingly. What’s more, your lists can be shared with friends and family to make sure that everyone stays on top of what is needed. 

Listonic top-rated app helps millions of people around the world save time and money by smart planning and managing their groceries. 

This is how it works on Alexa:

First, you have to registrate a Listonic account on app.listonic.com or in our mobile app. 

Then you can:
- Add a new list with “Create list Joe’s Birthday Party”
- Add items to your list: "Add apple"
- Check and uncheck items with "Check/uncheck apple on Joe’s Birthday Party"
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “ Read list Joe’s Birthday Party”

To do multiple things consecutively start with:
- "Alexa, open Listonic."
After the welcome message continue with:
- "Change the default list to Joe’s Birthday Party."
- "What is on my list?"
- "Add 2 kilograms of apples to my list."
review: Seems to work ok, but just started with the Alexa app.  Have been using Listonic for awhile.  Doesn't seem to have the ability to add a sequence of items.

description:
Edmunds brings more than 50 years of automotive knowledge to your Alexa-enabled device with a  new way to access car shopping and ownership tools. Now, Alexa can help you shop for a car, appraise a vehicle, calculate cost of ownership, find out when your next service is due, and much more.

name: AisleWise
description:
The Alexa Aisle Wise skill lets you add items or recipes to your AisleWise grocery shopping list.  

You must have an existing AisleWise account to use this skill from Alexa. If you do not have an account, simply visit AisleWise.com and sign up.  

Once you have an account, you can add any item to your AisleWise shopping list with a simple command.  You can also add recipes to your shopping list, but the recipe must first exist in your personal AisleWise recipes collection. 

Note about recipes: when you first create a recipe, you segregate recipe items into ingredients (items not normally in your refrigerator or pantry) and staples (items normally in your refrigerator or pantry). When you tell AisleWise to add a recipe to your list using Alexa, ingredients only are added.

comment heading: The List part works well, but can’t use recipe part on Echo Show
review: When I signed up for AnyList I noticed the recipe portion and thought it would be useful.  I’ve been using the List part of the Skill a LOT and it’s been fabulous.  However, after importing my most used recipes, I found I could not view them on the Echo Show.  Once I can view my recipes on the Show, I’ll increase the rating to 5 stars.

name: Carter's Customer Service
description: Use Alexa to ask questions about all your  Carter's, OshKosh B'gosh or Skip Hop orders. Get status updates any time you like with the voice-activated convenience you love from Alexa.
review: I just placed another order for a few tshirts for Valentine's Day for my Grandchildren.  Almost all of the clothes I buy them and my grandnieces and nephews are from Carters.  The quality is awesome and the styles are adorable!  I shop frequently for my babes and it seems that everything I buy is on sale,  which is amazing!  Fortunately, I shop so much I am constantly getting reward money - which I immediately use to order new things.  And did I mention the Holiday clothes?  There is always a large selection for every Holiday!  Can you tell I love Carters?

name: Levi's Assistant
description: Use Alexa to get answers to common questions about our services. Get help on return policy, how to use gift cards, available payment methods, and more.  Get help on finding a pair of jeans.  Get help on finding the nearest store.  Get help with tracking your order.  Get information on the latest promotions.
review: I went through the experience and was able to ask questions around their return policy which was helpful given the nature of their product. I also found the closest store to me via asking Alexa.It was a pretty cool and seamless customer experience!

name: Kit
description: Ask Kit to recommend products for your hobbies, gifts, or for getting things done.  Kit will find the best products and gear from top experts and influencers.
review: It's really cool how Kit tells me the experts who recommend the product as well as the product itself. I'd love to be able to add the recommended product to my Amazon shopping list, hopefully that feature comes soon!

name: Buyhatke Assistant
description:
Buyhatke Assistant is on now Alexa. Currently, it offers two features.
1. Compare product prices: Say 'search iPhone 7s' or 'compare iPhone 7s prices' and it will give you prices of iPhone 7s on available e-commerce websites. Say 'more' to iterate through the list or say 'repeat' to hear the list again. 
2. Best deals on Flight: Either say 'book a flight' and let Alexa handle the rest or if you are in hurry say 'book a flight from Banglore to Delhi for tomorrow' and it will give you best flight deals available across all other available sites.

name: Out Of Milk
description:
With Out of Milk, manage your shopping list with just your voice. Easily add or remove various products and sync your lists with family and friends. Out of Milk lets you keep track of all of your lists, and automatically syncs to your phone. Keep your pantry and your fridge fresh!


Our Features:
-Easily create and edit your shopping lists
- Sync your shopping lists in real-time
- Quickly add and remove items on your lists
- Manage an inventory of your pantry
- Keep your lists synced from Alexa to your phone

You can always access your lists through our mobile apps and online on our website: http://www.outofmilk.com/. 


WHAT THE EXPERTS ARE SAYING:

'The Out of Milk app is straightforward and offers three main list functions: shopping, pantry and to do.'
Wall Street Journal

'#1 of Top 25 Apps For Moms'
Babble 

'Top 10 Most-Used Shopping Apps'
Nielsen  

'How To Simplify your grocery shopping on Android'
CNET  

'Grocery List Apps That Make Shopping, Syncing Lists Simple'
Mashable
comment heading: Had over 5 Grocery apps in past 5 years ... APP & CS is the best by far!
review:
I too experienced issues with Alexa skill but CS was on it. Over my lifetime of grocery apps, O.O.M. was the most responsive & responsible to its application & customers and the wait for fix wasn't too bad considering. It is important to not only is having a great app important but so is a great CS.

Having an Akexa skill or any other assistant makes Out of Milk one of the most competitive apps out there. To be able to be "all hands on" a meal and ask Alexa to add an item you notice getting low is, to me, priceless. And, although there are other grocery apps that also have an Alexa skill, O.O.M. has a note & price field that I've experienced I really needed. Thank you!

name: This Is Ground
description:
New** Say "spin the globe" for randomized info on different cities across the globe.

"Use the This is Ground skill to get all the info you need on the brand, products, community and more.

Once the skill is enabled, start by saying ""Alexa, ask This is Ground.""

For information on products, try saying:

""Alexa, ask This is Ground about the Venture Backpack."""

review: I love the app, and had been using it for many months,  but a competing app, Our Groceries, activated echo voice input months ago. Voice commands execute much more fluid on Our Groceries skill, and allow you to add items to any existing list without having to ask echo to switch to a list first. I have also never had echo reject what I request to add to my list on Our Groceries skill. Out of Milk skill seems to reject various things like Gouda Cheese and Chips Ahoy Cookies.

name: Place Information
description: Finds places that are close to you based on a query.  Works with different types of food and also different stores, banks, shops, etc.
review: the app does the same thing as Alexa would give strait up and it doesn't give hours like Alexa does.

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
review: App only for iOS. No Android app

name: AisleWise
description:
The Alexa Aisle Wise skill lets you add items or recipes to your AisleWise grocery shopping list.  

You must have an existing AisleWise account to use this skill from Alexa. If you do not have an account, simply visit AisleWise.com and sign up.  

Once you have an account, you can add any item to your AisleWise shopping list with a simple command.  You can also add recipes to your shopping list, but the recipe must first exist in your personal AisleWise recipes collection. 

Note about recipes: when you first create a recipe, you segregate recipe items into ingredients (items not normally in your refrigerator or pantry) and staples (items normally in your refrigerator or pantry). When you tell AisleWise to add a recipe to your list using Alexa, ingredients only are added.

name: Macy's Orders
description:
This skill allows users to track their orders through the Alexa App and Echo. To use this skill, follow these instructions:
1- Subscribe to link your package to your Alexa account through the tracking page sent to you by Macy's.
2- Interact with your Alexa enabled device by asking one of the following questions, Alexa, ask Macy's Orders where is my package or Alexa, ask Macy's Orders to track package
review: The link account function brings up the sign in page for Amazon!  WTH?

name: 1-800-Flowers
description:
Send truly original and unique floral arrangements, plants and gifts in minutes with the 1-800-Flowers Skill. Simply enable Amazon Pay on your Alexa App, and you can start gifting with our 1-800-Flowers Skill! 

Find gifts for any occasion with ease by telling Alexa what type of gift you’re looking for (roses, sunflowers, gift baskets, chocolates, etc.) and Alexa will recommend one of our curated gifts from our Family of Brands for you to send. Not sure what gift you want to send? Simply tell Alexa who you would like to send a gift to (wife, mom, co-worker, grandparent, friend) and for what occasion (birthday, anniversary, graduation, sympathy, housewarming, holidays), and Alexa will recommend one of our truly original gifts. 

To complete the transaction, answer a few quick questions about the recipient’s delivery address and delivery date and pay with Amazon Pay. Your recipient will be receiving their gift with a smile shortly!

Meet Our Family of Brands:
[+] Cheryl’s Cookies
[+] FruitBouquets.com
[+] 1800Baskets.com
[+] Simply Chocolate
[+] Personalization Universe
[+] The Popcorn Factory
[+] Harry and David
[+] Wolferman’s
[+] Stock Yards
review: Trying so hard to use the service but it keep failing and signing off. Disappointing.

review:
Any List was always very functional but as an Alexa skill, it is super convenient, especially in the kitchen while cooking.

This function is one of the most useful skills available on Alexa. Although playing music is still my most utilized skill.

name: Woot
description: This skill allows you to quickly and easily learn about Woot's daily deals on any of the Woot categories. To get started, you just have to ask Woot for the daily deal. You can also get more specific by asking about deals in a particular category such as shirt deal.
comment heading: DOES NOT RECOGNIZE ANY WOOT COMMANDS

I'm a regular Woot customer so thought this would be great.
Alas, Alexa does not recognize any of my commands for this.

name: Black Friday
description: Use the Black Friday Skill to find out Black Friday deals
review: Who needs a PowerPoint presentation when you have Amazon Alexa Echo Show?  VoiceXP has taken marketing retail to the next level.  I can't see what else this company comes up with next.

review: Thank you for a great app!  I have multiple different lisfs that j’ve given Alexa access to (you have to enable Alexa’s access to each list you want her to add from), so I just tell her to add whatever to my Costco list or my grocery list or my Target list.  Love the convenience of adding things with Alexa when my hands are full or I’m in the middle of something else.

review: This skill was on my wish list when I got Alexa earlier this year. I like how easy it is to add things to the Alexa shopping list in the AnyList app. Like others, being able to add to my existing lists would be ideal however I've been thinking about combining my Costco and grocery lists into one and using the store function anyway.

description: Black Friday calendar can tell you door buster hours and sale hours for major retailers like Walmart, Target, Best Buy, Old Navy, Staples, Bed bath and beyond, costco,Gamestop, Home Depot, Lowe's,JCP, Macy's

Not Ready for Prime Time.
You CAN'T direct which list to add the item to.
Alexa responds that the item has been added, but my account has 6 lists
And the items NEVER appear in the desired list - the one shared by my wife and me
So - - until the developers FIX THIS - - it'll NOT find use in our household

name: Product Feedback
description: Product Feedback lets you give voice feedback on consumer products. This skill will capture opinions on and experience of mainstream brands in three categories. The categories include bodycare (e.g. Dove), haircare (e.g. Tresemme) and laundry (e.g. Comfort).
review: Just got an email titled "What's New With Alexa." Let me tell you, I do not need Alexa to give me a Jedi mind trick or talk like Yoda. These are useless commands. How about a much needed audiobook or mp3 command: “Alexa, fast forward 10 seconds.” Or “Alexa, rewind 10 seconds.”  Or one minute, etc. These are commands I can actually use.
