name: Discount Contacts Reorder
description:
The best way to reorder contacts from DiscountContacts.com is with voice shopping! Simply say “Alexa, reorder contacts with Discount Contacts” to your Echo or Dot and the skill will set up an order from your last purchase at DiscountContacts.com, including 10 percent off every voice order.
 
Alexa will offer you the option to create a four digit pin for more secure ordering. To complete the transaction, the Discount Contacts Reorder Skill will read back your last order, and if it’s correct, tell Alexa “yes” to complete your order. The charge will be placed on the credit card DiscountContacts.com has on file. The prescription will be verified by our Customer Service Team and any required Rx updates will be communicated to you by phone or email.
 
Your first order must be placed via the DiscountContacts.com website, mobile site, or with our Customer Service Team at 1-800-822-9864. After your initial order you can reorder via Alexa using your DiscountContacts.com account.
 
DiscountContacts.com is the best place to shop for contact lenses online. Find cheap contacts from Acuvue, Air Optix, Biofinity, Dailies, Biotrue, Proclear, and more.
 
o   New customers receive 20% off their first order
o   Free shipping over $99
o   365-day returns
o   Lowest prices guaranteed
o   Wide selection of contacts from toric contact lenses, daily contacts, multifocal/presbyopia contact lenses, and more
o   Receive discounts, sales, and coupons on glasses, prescription sunglasses, reading glasses, and other eyewear from our sister site DiscountGlasses.com
review: After linking my account I simply had to say the phrase and Alexa read back my previous order details, asked me to confirm and placed the order in a total of 5 seconds.no clicking or any work involved. so fast and easy!

name: Steal of the week
description:
STEAL DEALS NOT PACKAGES 
All you need is a phone number or email and you can have the latest deals sent to you. We do the work of finding the best deals on the internet, you relax, ask Alexa for “The Steal of the Week” and choose which deals you want sent to you. 
Our deals are always a great steal.

name: dealfomo
description: Dealfomo knows about the best deals from the best retailers available now.  You can ask many different questions about deals and even search for deals with your voice!  This skill is the voice-powered companion to dealfomo.com!
review: I asked the same question 5 times and got random answers each time. None of which were even close to the original question. Disabling!!

name: Secret Santa Gift Ideas
description: Having trouble finding the gift for your Secret Santa event? Look no further! This skill will suggest cheap and fun gift ideas for your Secret Santa event!

name: Listonic - smart grocery list
description:
The Listonic skill improves the quality of your grocery shopping by making it easier, faster, and most importantly smarter. It is all you would want out of a shopping list app and more.

Plan your grocery shopping hands-free by dictating entire lists to Alexa. Listonic instantly syncs with Alexa giving you instant access to all your lists which you can then manage accordingly. What’s more, your lists can be shared with friends and family to make sure that everyone stays on top of what is needed. 

Listonic top-rated app helps millions of people around the world save time and money by smart planning and managing their groceries. 

This is how it works on Alexa:

First, you have to registrate a Listonic account on app.listonic.com or in our mobile app. 

Then you can:
- Add a new list with “Create list Joe’s Birthday Party”
- Add items to your list: "Add apple"
- Check and uncheck items with "Check/uncheck apple on Joe’s Birthday Party"
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “ Read list Joe’s Birthday Party”

To do multiple things consecutively start with:
- "Alexa, open Listonic."
After the welcome message continue with:
- "Change the default list to Joe’s Birthday Party."
- "What is on my list?"
- "Add 2 kilograms of apples to my list."
review: Without warning, it erased the 12 different lists I had made.  These represented hours of work.

name: My Grocer
description:
This app allows you to build a shopping list/cart with your voice, impressively fast.

Say "Add wine and meat and strawberries and chocolate and flowers." and get yourself ready for that special dinner.
review: I constantly forget when I’m trying to remember everything I need at the store and now I have a companion ......... ALEXA!👍👌

name: Walmart Stories
description: Listen to Walmart Stories to discover how Walmart is using innovative technologies to redefine the associate and customer experience.

name: MatHem.se
description:
Shop groceries at MatHem.se using your voice. You ask Alexa for products in English and we'll translate it to Swedish before adding it to your cart.

Please note that this skill requires account linking with an existing account at MatHem.se.

Please also note that this is a product targeting https://www.mathem.se. To place orders using the skill you will need to have a previously placed order through https://www.mathem.se.

When you ask for a product, for example 'milk', we'll translate milk into Swedish and perform a category search for it. We order the results based on your previous orders, so if your preference is organic lactose free milk, that is what you will get.

To prevent unintentional purchases we recommend you to add a four digit pincode that you will be prompted to say before placing your order. Your cart and orders are synced in real-time to https://www.mathem.se and the mobile apps, so if you require more advanced features, please use a device with a visual interface.

You are also welcome to contact our customer support by phone, chat or email: https://www.mathem.se/kundtjanst/kontakt
review: I managed to place an order for tomorrow by only using my voice <3

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
review: Works great! Like other just wish I could use existing lists...but this is fantastic!

name: Ship.com — Automatic Package Tracker
description:
Ship.com keeps track of all your online orders, so you don't have to.

It starts with syncing the email you shop with to Ship.com. Ship.com finds your tracking numbers and gives you real-time updates on everything you order online, from retailers all over the internet.

Never miss a package again. You’ll receive notifications as your package makes its way to you, so you know exactly where it is and when you'll get it. Ship.com supports all major US carriers like Amazon, UPS, USPS, FedEx and more!

GET STARTED → Sign up on Ship.com or download the Ship.com iOS/Android app at http://ship.com

——

ALEXA

- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my stuff is"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my packages are"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com when my stuff is coming"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my next package is"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com when my last package arrived"

——

FEATURES

Automatic Tracking — don't bother looking for tracking numbers again. Ship.com finds them and magically syncs them into the app. (Works with Gmail, for now).
Real-Time Updates — notifications are sent to your phone, so you know where your packages are, and when you should be ready to be pick them up!
Privacy Matters — keeping your information private and secure is very important to us. We’ll never sell your personal data or emails.

——

HAVING ISSUES?

Ship.com is still in Beta and we would love to hear if you're running into issues or have any feedback for us. Email us at help@ship.com, reach out on twitter @ShipHQ or live chat with us on the Ship.com website.

Is there a specific order tracking code or email that Ship.com didn't pick up automatically? Forward your tracking email to track@ship.com and our experts will take a look!
review: she will read off how many packages I have that are scheduled to be delivered but only tells me about 1. I have no clue what to say to find out about the rest of my packages. I might as well just be using the app at least there I can see where my packages are and when they will be here!!! there should be an option for her to read off all packages that are coming. there's nothing I have been able to say or do to get her to do that. so I know I have several packages on the way but I only know about 1. Please fix this either that or this is a useless skill.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
review: I lynced up the app, and wanted to test it. Alexa claims it added the item to the list, but it doesn’t appear anywhere.  I wanted to give this less than 1 star but it won’t alllow me to

name: BJ's Wholesale Club
description:
The BJ’s Wholesale Club skill enables you to learn more about your available My BJ’s Perks® Awards, Membership status, and BJ’s Gas® prices.

For now, use the BJ’s skill to inquire about:
-   Available BJ’s Perks® Awards associated with your Membership account;
-   Current Membership status and expiration date; and
-   BJ’s Gas® prices near you.

And, we’re just getting started with more exciting skill enhancements to come in the future.  Please stay tuned for updates.

Please note, before you start using this skill, you will need to link your BJ’s online account. If you don’t have an online account, you will need to create your account first to access the BJ’s skill.
review: Ok

name: Product Feedback
description: Product Feedback lets you give voice feedback on consumer products. This skill will capture opinions on and experience of mainstream brands in three categories. The categories include bodycare (e.g. Dove), haircare (e.g. Tresemme) and laundry (e.g. Comfort).
comment heading: Came home from out of town to find this "ROOMMATE" invading my space.
review: Don't much like that it's on constant eavesdropping mode, but realize that can't be helped.  I listen to a lot of NPR, specifically the program THIS AMERICAN LIFE... more recently there seems to be a connection glitch and it keeps connecting to a program called MY ADHD LIFE. PLEASE FIX, AMAZON ALEXA HUMANS. Oy... Also Alexa has such WIndows® variety "nerds 1.0 on parade" humor. Not Apple Siri by a long shot, as cultural and colloquial awareness goes. We often ask Alexa if she's gotten a sense of humor yet and the response is always "HMM I don't know that one". Tell me about it. [Insert exasperated sigh, eyes rolled up into crown of head] Try asking Alexa and Siri "What's one divided by zero". Not useful in any practical way...but daily humor is of an immensely underrated value in the coldness of modern digital life. It reminds us that a thread of connective tissue (aka Humanity via creative syntax and cultural memes)  still exists in the lonely vacuum of bent-over heads and rapidly fluttering fingers over devices.

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!
review:
Works poorly. I love the Bring! app on my phone. Use it regularly for shopping with the family so everyone can add things. So having Alexa integration was awesome, if it would work!

Had no problem syncing it to my main grocery list (no idea how to pick a different list to add things too appropriate list.  Here's an idea, have a command to List my lists, so I know what Alexa calls them).
Hassle to open.  Have to say "Alexa, open Bring!", she says "welcome to bring, how can I help" ,then after each item is added she has to talk more.  Keep the skill open forever.  I installed if for a reason. I should just be able to say "Alexa, add milk to my list" without activating a skill EVERY time.

But I could live with this, but the kicker, Bring! constantly gets it wrong.  Alexa understands my voice fairly well, but for some reason, Bring! gets the item wrong 6 out of 10 times.  I say something clearly, and she adds some obscure item.  If it is wrong, I have no way of removing and re-speaking it.  I ALWAYS end up opening the phone app to correct the misunderstandings, or to verify she understood.

I really want this skill to work.  It is a great skill in theory, and I keep trying hoping it will improve, but after weeks and weeks of using it, I decided it was time to write a review.

Bring! Labs.... PLEASE fix this!
Make her talk less,
Allow me to delete last entry.  If I say "delete" right after she repeats the entry, would be nice, because she is wrong SO often.
Give option to read the list (even things added previously from the phone app)
Provide some instructions.  I'm just guessing on this Alexa skill.  Need a "help" command.

2 stars is being generous, only because I like the idea of this and hope it will get fixed.

comment heading: generic list not ANY list NOW almost ANY list
review:
I love Anylist but find it's interface with Alexa stunted.  Items cannot be added to specific lists but only the generic Alexa shopping list.  Drilling down into (adding items to) specific lists would be welcome (#newskill).  This is especially true since these unique lists can be shared with Alexa who can tell you what's on them but not interact with (add/delete items) them.

modding this review.  As a test, I tried to get Alexa to add items to my BJs list on Anylist.  But Alexa did not recognize Bj's.  I tried Giant and Walmart lists and it did put items directly into those custom lists - lists that I had already created in Anylist and then selected to sync with Alexa.  So yes - it works, but for some reason it does not recognize all my Anylist list names.  So I'm gonna try to train Alexa.

I see many have shared what I wrote as first review.  If it was a flaw, it's been fixed.  First check your settings and make sure "Sync with Amazon Alexa" is on.  You should at that point be able to say "Alexa, put [item] in my [list name] shopping list."

As soon as it recognizes "Bj's" this rating will go to five stars.

name: eBags
description: Use Alexa to ask questions about all youreBags orders. Get status updates any time you like with the voice-activated convenience you love from Alexa.
comment heading: Too much work for too little return
review:
Cumbersome to use in the best case.  You'd have to remember very specific commands, and even then the information provided is incomplete.
An example in the skill description says to ask, "Alexa, ask ebags where is my order?".  Doing that I got the reply, "I didn't find any open orders for you".
One of the other reviews says to start with, “Alexa talk to eBags".  That got the Alexa response, "You have ebags enabled. Do you want to open it?".  A 'yes', gave a couple of options including "When will my order arrive?".  Asking that, the response was that my package was 'in transit', without giving the arrival date even though a date is listed on the UPS site.

name: Shop Clerk
description:
Shop Clerk lets you check the status of orders from any Shop Clerk-enabled website. As orders are placed, shipped and delivered, Shop Clerk keeps up with the latest status of your order and allows you to keep up to date.

HOW TO USE:

To Enable the Skill: Say "Alexa, enable Shop Clerk skill" or search for “Shop Clerk skill" in the Alexa mobile app or at Amazon.com. Click the enable button on the Shop Clerk skill page.

To use the skill, you must first have placed an order at an ecommerce site that supports ShopClerk order checking. Once you’ve placed an order with a site that uses Shop Clerk, you’ll receive an email with a ‘Shop Clerk Pass Code’. This code is a unique phrase that allows you to get the latest status of your order. Pass codes are easy to remember phrases of 4 words — for example, ‘Alpha Tango Romeo Bravo’.

To check the status of an order, say: “Alexa, ask Shop Clerk about pass code Alpha Tango Romeo Bravo”. Shop Clerk will then tell you the latest status of your order.

The order status in Shop Clerk is updated whenever the on-line store you made the purchase from updates the order in their system. So you’ll always have the latest information whenever you check. 


FEEDBACK AND SUPPORT:

We hope you’ll love Shop Clerk and give us a 5-star rating. If you feel that Shop Clerk deserves less than a 5-star rating, please let us know at support@shopclerk.ai and we'll do everything in our power to make it better.

If there’s an on-line store you’d like to see added, just e-mail us at support@shopclerk.ai.

We'd love to hear from you! If you have questions, comments, or feedback, please e-mail us at support@shopclerk.ai. Thank you!
comment heading: I would love to see more online stores incorporate this feature
review: I really got a kick out of tracking my first order with ShopClerk.  Super-easy and super-convenient.  I would love to see more online stores incorporate this feature.  It just seems like a "no-brainer" considering the way technology is heading.  Great service.

review: no samples available

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
review: It’s been functioning great for me so far, no issues or complaints!  I love to simply be able to tell Alexa to add something to my list. Yes, it might be cool if you could add multiple items rather than one at a time, however, to me the main purpose of this is to be able to add items as you think of them/need them. I open the fridge and see I’m low on milk, “Alexa, add milk to my shopping list.”  Done!  Without grabbing my phone, it’s there. Then 10 minutes later I notice another item to add. Easy and simple. Sure it could be cool in certain scenarios where I do have a long list to add, in which case it could get tiring saying each item one at a time, but for the most part the ability to add things to your list with your voice is to avoid needing to sit down and think... “what are all the items I’m currently out of and need to pick up at the store....”. I don’t need to do this, because I slowly added them as they came to mind. And that to me is what makes this so awesome and functional for my life!  Even before I used Alexa, generally I was only adding one or two items at a time to my list, and this is what would be annoying. I’d grab my phone, add an item, minutes or so later I’d remember something else I need, back to my phone to write it down. Now I simply keep doing what I’m doing, tell Alexa and it’s done!

name: My Deal
description:
We find hundreds of deals every day and can’t wait to share with you. We tailor deals that interests you.. Tell us which deals you like, as we get to know you better, we will target deals that fits your preferences.

You will receive a four-character personal code (such as“DEMO”), which you can use to review the detail of the deals that you liked at www.mydealweb.com.


How to use:

To launch:
     “ Alexa, open my deal. ”

To search for particular deals by keyword (For example: Amazon, iPhone, Women's Outerwear):
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of Amazon. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal what are the deals for iPhone. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal to tell me the deals for women's outerwear. ”

If you find deals you are interested in, like them by numbers and view the detail on your phone:
     “ one, two and four ”
     “ second and third ”
     “ first two ”
     “ last one ”

Or go to the next group:
     “ next ”

Or want to listen again:
     “ repeat ”

Of cause you can always get help by:
     “ help ”

Or exist any time by:
     “ Alexa, stop. ”


How did we grow up:

Mar-18-2017:

	Now we can search for deals by keyword! Just say: “Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of (Keyword).”

Mar-08-2017:

	Now we have a website “www.mydealweb.com”, where you can review the deals you liked with your personal code! 

Feb-28-2017:

	Your deals are not randomly selected any more. They are based on what you liked before!

Feb-18-2017:

	Choose the deals you like by the Deal Number, we will send the detail via the Alexa App!

Feb-08-2017:

	Now you can listen to the next group of deals by saying “Next” or the previous group of deals by saying “Repeat”, and get help any time by saying “Help”.

Jan-28-2017:

	Launched! With 5 deals every time.


We're always learning and building new features, and we can't do that well without your feedback. If you have comments, please share them with us at www.mydealweb.com/feedback.

name: MailHaven Package Tracker
description:
This skill requires users to have an account via the Mailhaven iOS app (see download link below).

Download the Mailhaven iOS app here 

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/mailhaven/id1189399189?ls=1&mt=8

Generally, a user will have packages being shipped to them and tracked on mailhaven app. This skill will allow users to ask mailhaven for information on their packages.

name: REI Co-op
description:
The REI Co-op voice assistant allows Alexa to provide REI's Deal of the Day, REI store locations, equipment rental information, and up-to-date information on REI classes, events and garage sales.

REI is a national outdoor retail co-op dedicated to inspiring, educating, and outfitting its members and the community for a lifetime of outdoor adventure and stewardship.

To get started, enable the REI Co-op skill. Then just say:

"Alexa, ask REI about the Deal of the Day"
"Alexa, ask REI what garage sales are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what garage sales are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI to find stores near me"
"Alexa, ask REI to find stores near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what classes are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what classes are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what events are coming up"
"Alexa, ask REI what events are coming up near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI what equipment can I rent near me"
"Alexa, ask REI what equipment can I rent near {City} {State}"
"Alexa, ask REI about the benefits of becoming an REI Co-op member"

Alternatively, you can start an interactive session by saying: "Alexa, start REI"

review: Loved using send me a sample! Would definitely recommend to everyone.  It was very easy to navigate and I got a free Dunkin Donuts Shot in the dark coffee espresso a few days later.

name: GiftJoy
description:
Welcome to GiftJoy - the new, convenient, and enjoyable way to instantly send eGift cards to family and friends! 

You can choose from over 100 top retailers such as Starbucks, Fandango, Sephora, Barnes & Noble, Applebee's, Domino's, Uber, Nordstrom, Target, Old Navy, Kohl's, and Nike.  

Simply tell Alexa your order by saying: 

"Alexa, open GiftJoy!" or "Alexa, ask GiftJoy to send a gift card."

Through voice, you'll be prompted for your order details such as your name, the recipient's name, the gift card brand and value, when you want the eGift card to be delivered, and your personalized greeting.  

You'll then get a text message with a link to review your order and enter your payment details.  So don't worry if you make a mistake, you'll be able to easily make edits in the next step. 

The recipient will get a text message (or email, if you prefer) with a link to the eGift card, which can be redeemed online or in-store.  PLUS: if they prefer a different brand, they can make a swap without any fees.  That means you'll always be sending the perfect gift!

After you've placed an order, you can ask for your order history.  "Alexa, ask GiftJoy for my order history."  You'll also get notified  (via email) when the recipient opens their gift. 

Happy Gifting!!

We'd love to hear about your GiftJoy experience: team@giftjoy.us
Our website: giftjoy.us
List of Retailers: giftjoy.us/retailers
review: Super easy way to send giftcards. Just give Alexa the info, and it's off!

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!

comment heading: Love out of milk.. Hate this skill
review:
Update.. Sept 13..just got email from out of milk (yay for them reaching out to me) and evidently there's an "Alexa" list in the out of milk app that I didn't know about and sure enough, after asking Alexa to add milk to my out of milk list, IT DID! yay! Thanks out of milk for the help!

Oh good grief! I've been telling Alexa for 15 minutes to add milk to my out of milk list and she keeps saying she did it but milk is nowhere! Not in the Alexa shopping list or the out of milk list. Too bad cuz I use out of milk all the time. Will be disabling skill.

name: Kit
description: Ask Kit to recommend products for your hobbies, gifts, or for getting things done.  Kit will find the best products and gear from top experts and influencers.
review: I just disabled this skill. Out of 5 attempts, Kit was able to make a recommendation for engine belts when I asked about toothpaste, could not make a recommendation 3 times for other common products, then finally made one accurate recommendation for a coffee maker. Unfortunately, Alexa rattled off the brand and product names very quickly. I checked my history in the app and kit provided what appears to be an amateur photo of the coffee maker without listing the brand, name, or providing any way to purchase it. I think two stars is generous considering that it was only able to make one accurate recommendation and it wasn't useful.

name: Purell
description:
PURELL® products are trusted and used in hospitals to help prevent the spread of infection. Now that same germ-fighting power is available for everyone - at home, at work and on the go. 

From innovative soap and sanitizer formulation, to breakthrough dispensing systems and portable solutions, the same commitment to well-being goes into every product we make.

We bring that same commitment to our new Amazon Alexa skill, PURELL® Assistant, which will share our hand hygiene and sanitation know-how with new and long-time friends alike. Use this skill to find out more about our gentle, effective products and to hear tips for keeping your family healthy and well.

Disclaimer: The information in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.

name: Ship.com — Automatic Package Tracker
description:
Ship.com keeps track of all your online orders, so you don't have to.

It starts with syncing the email you shop with to Ship.com. Ship.com finds your tracking numbers and gives you real-time updates on everything you order online, from retailers all over the internet.

Never miss a package again. You’ll receive notifications as your package makes its way to you, so you know exactly where it is and when you'll get it. Ship.com supports all major US carriers like Amazon, UPS, USPS, FedEx and more!

GET STARTED → Sign up on Ship.com or download the Ship.com iOS/Android app at http://ship.com

——

ALEXA

- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my stuff is"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my packages are"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com when my stuff is coming"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my next package is"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com when my last package arrived"

——

FEATURES

Automatic Tracking — don't bother looking for tracking numbers again. Ship.com finds them and magically syncs them into the app. (Works with Gmail, for now).
Real-Time Updates — notifications are sent to your phone, so you know where your packages are, and when you should be ready to be pick them up!
Privacy Matters — keeping your information private and secure is very important to us. We’ll never sell your personal data or emails.

——

HAVING ISSUES?

Ship.com is still in Beta and we would love to hear if you're running into issues or have any feedback for us. Email us at help@ship.com, reach out on twitter @ShipHQ or live chat with us on the Ship.com website.

Is there a specific order tracking code or email that Ship.com didn't pick up automatically? Forward your tracking email to track@ship.com and our experts will take a look!
review: account not syncing even though i used same email as amazon then linked google as a secondary. nothing is showing, but then i made an account using just my google and it shows tracking in app but no way to link or sign into the skill. it should be updated to allow us to use whatever  login method to authorize the skill to stop this confusion

name: Discount Contacts Reorder
description:
The best way to reorder contacts from DiscountContacts.com is with voice shopping! Simply say “Alexa, reorder contacts with Discount Contacts” to your Echo or Dot and the skill will set up an order from your last purchase at DiscountContacts.com, including 10 percent off every voice order.
 
Alexa will offer you the option to create a four digit pin for more secure ordering. To complete the transaction, the Discount Contacts Reorder Skill will read back your last order, and if it’s correct, tell Alexa “yes” to complete your order. The charge will be placed on the credit card DiscountContacts.com has on file. The prescription will be verified by our Customer Service Team and any required Rx updates will be communicated to you by phone or email.
 
Your first order must be placed via the DiscountContacts.com website, mobile site, or with our Customer Service Team at 1-800-822-9864. After your initial order you can reorder via Alexa using your DiscountContacts.com account.
 
DiscountContacts.com is the best place to shop for contact lenses online. Find cheap contacts from Acuvue, Air Optix, Biofinity, Dailies, Biotrue, Proclear, and more.
 
o   New customers receive 20% off their first order
o   Free shipping over $99
o   365-day returns
o   Lowest prices guaranteed
o   Wide selection of contacts from toric contact lenses, daily contacts, multifocal/presbyopia contact lenses, and more
o   Receive discounts, sales, and coupons on glasses, prescription sunglasses, reading glasses, and other eyewear from our sister site DiscountGlasses.com

name: Woot

2.  Then, place an order and enjoy reading it! (Alexa can also read it for you. )

"Alexa, start Ebook Selector "
"Alexa, launch Ebook Selector  "

All these books belong to the individual person who published it. We are transmitting it from best and random sources available on the internet.

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at vignesh2406@gmail.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!

name: My Deal
description:
We find hundreds of deals every day and can’t wait to share with you. We tailor deals that interests you.. Tell us which deals you like, as we get to know you better, we will target deals that fits your preferences.

You will receive a four-character personal code (such as“DEMO”), which you can use to review the detail of the deals that you liked at www.mydealweb.com.


How to use:

To launch:
     “ Alexa, open my deal. ”

To search for particular deals by keyword (For example: Amazon, iPhone, Women's Outerwear):
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of Amazon. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal what are the deals for iPhone. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal to tell me the deals for women's outerwear. ”

If you find deals you are interested in, like them by numbers and view the detail on your phone:
     “ one, two and four ”
     “ second and third ”
     “ first two ”
     “ last one ”

Or go to the next group:
     “ next ”

Or want to listen again:
     “ repeat ”

Of cause you can always get help by:
     “ help ”

Or exist any time by:
     “ Alexa, stop. ”


How did we grow up:

Mar-18-2017:

	Now we can search for deals by keyword! Just say: “Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of (Keyword).”

Mar-08-2017:

	Now we have a website “www.mydealweb.com”, where you can review the deals you liked with your personal code! 

Feb-28-2017:

	Your deals are not randomly selected any more. They are based on what you liked before!

Feb-18-2017:

	Choose the deals you like by the Deal Number, we will send the detail via the Alexa App!

Feb-08-2017:

	Now you can listen to the next group of deals by saying “Next” or the previous group of deals by saying “Repeat”, and get help any time by saying “Help”.

Jan-28-2017:

	Launched! With 5 deals every time.


We're always learning and building new features, and we can't do that well without your feedback. If you have comments, please share them with us at www.mydealweb.com/feedback.

name: 1-800-Flowers
description:
Send truly original and unique floral arrangements, plants and gifts in minutes with the 1-800-Flowers Skill. Simply enable Amazon Pay on your Alexa App, and you can start gifting with our 1-800-Flowers Skill! 

Find gifts for any occasion with ease by telling Alexa what type of gift you’re looking for (roses, sunflowers, gift baskets, chocolates, etc.) and Alexa will recommend one of our curated gifts from our Family of Brands for you to send. Not sure what gift you want to send? Simply tell Alexa who you would like to send a gift to (wife, mom, co-worker, grandparent, friend) and for what occasion (birthday, anniversary, graduation, sympathy, housewarming, holidays), and Alexa will recommend one of our truly original gifts. 

To complete the transaction, answer a few quick questions about the recipient’s delivery address and delivery date and pay with Amazon Pay. Your recipient will be receiving their gift with a smile shortly!

Meet Our Family of Brands:
[+] Cheryl’s Cookies
[+] FruitBouquets.com
[+] 1800Baskets.com
[+] Simply Chocolate
[+] Personalization Universe
[+] The Popcorn Factory
[+] Harry and David
[+] Wolferman’s
[+] Stock Yards
review: Sent my mom flowers and she loved them!

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!
review: It is so nice to finally have a list app that works on my phone, smart watch and Alexa. Our family has been using this for about a week now, and we really like it. No bugs either. I do have a suggestion though - it would be nice if we could simply say which list we want to add the item to rather than having to change the default list each time. Ex: Alexa, tell Bring to add milk to the "Costco" list (rather than having to change from the default "groceries" list to the "Costco" list beforehand).

name: Ship.com — Automatic Package Tracker
description:
Ship.com keeps track of all your online orders, so you don't have to.

It starts with syncing the email you shop with to Ship.com. Ship.com finds your tracking numbers and gives you real-time updates on everything you order online, from retailers all over the internet.

Never miss a package again. You’ll receive notifications as your package makes its way to you, so you know exactly where it is and when you'll get it. Ship.com supports all major US carriers like Amazon, UPS, USPS, FedEx and more!

GET STARTED → Sign up on Ship.com or download the Ship.com iOS/Android app at http://ship.com

——

ALEXA

- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my stuff is"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my packages are"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com when my stuff is coming"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com where my next package is"
- "Alexa, ask Ship.com when my last package arrived"

——

FEATURES

Automatic Tracking — don't bother looking for tracking numbers again. Ship.com finds them and magically syncs them into the app. (Works with Gmail, for now).
Real-Time Updates — notifications are sent to your phone, so you know where your packages are, and when you should be ready to be pick them up!
Privacy Matters — keeping your information private and secure is very important to us. We’ll never sell your personal data or emails.

——

HAVING ISSUES?

Ship.com is still in Beta and we would love to hear if you're running into issues or have any feedback for us. Email us at help@ship.com, reach out on twitter @ShipHQ or live chat with us on the Ship.com website.

Is there a specific order tracking code or email that Ship.com didn't pick up automatically? Forward your tracking email to track@ship.com and our experts will take a look!
comment heading: Tells Me When All My Packages Are Arriving - All retailers, all carriers in one place
review: I was tired of looking up tracking numbers in my email.  Luckily I stumbled across this skill.  This app tells me when all my packages are arriving from all retailers and all carriers.  Very cool.  And I just downloaded the phone app as well.

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
comment heading: Use google voice commands in Alexa App! I just HAVE to share this great tip for Alexa Lists!
review:
I was using the android alexa app to make a shopping list, thinking why isn't there voice control for this? On my android keyboard there is the Microphone I use for Google, so I tried it, Google came up, I spoke my grocery item and voila, it appeared in my Alexa grocery shopping list! I tapped the the Plus +, went to the next line, tapped microphone in the keyboard again,  Google came up, I spoke my next item, tapped the Plus sign again, and just kept going. Sooooo much easier than having spell each item out, (no predictive text).
Use google voice commands in Alexa App!

name: Best Buy
description:
Get Best Buy's latest deals using only your voice. You can also search for products, track your order status, hear store hours and locations, and get answers to frequently asked questions.

For the best shopping experience, take a moment to link your Best Buy account. And to make ordering even easier, make sure you have a default credit card and shipping address stored at BestBuy.com. If while using our skill you choose to have a text sent with more information, Best Buy will need access to your Amazon account mobile number.  Go to the home screen in your Alexa app to grant permission.

Use the Best Buy skill to:
- Buy our latest deals, including special voice-only offers
- Search our product catalog
- Get updated order status information
- Locate a store near you
- Learn about Best Buy’s return policy, or get answers to other FAQs
- Ask for tech tips like, "how do I set a default printer" or "help me with my modem"
- Discover gift ideas or purchase Best Buy gift cards
review:
Using Echo Show 2nd Gen. Launched properly after 3x attempts. Audio was good except for Of the (very limited) things it can do, only one of those actually worked. Showed ten
of “today’s deals”, of which #’s 3-5: audio glitches froze screen; skipped the #4deal;  repeated same deal for #’s 3.
Frustrated & ended up using iPhone BestBuy app instead.

With Out of Milk, manage your shopping list with just your voice. Easily add or remove various products and sync your lists with family and friends. Out of Milk lets you keep track of all of your lists, and automatically syncs to your phone. Keep your pantry and your fridge fresh!

name: Listonic - smart grocery list
description:
The Listonic skill improves the quality of your grocery shopping by making it easier, faster, and most importantly smarter. It is all you would want out of a shopping list app and more.

Plan your grocery shopping hands-free by dictating entire lists to Alexa. Listonic instantly syncs with Alexa giving you instant access to all your lists which you can then manage accordingly. What’s more, your lists can be shared with friends and family to make sure that everyone stays on top of what is needed. 

Listonic top-rated app helps millions of people around the world save time and money by smart planning and managing their groceries. 

This is how it works on Alexa:

First, you have to registrate a Listonic account on app.listonic.com or in our mobile app. 

Then you can:
- Add a new list with “Create list Joe’s Birthday Party”
- Add items to your list: "Add apple"
- Check and uncheck items with "Check/uncheck apple on Joe’s Birthday Party"
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “ Read list Joe’s Birthday Party”

To do multiple things consecutively start with:
- "Alexa, open Listonic."
After the welcome message continue with:
- "Change the default list to Joe’s Birthday Party."
- "What is on my list?"
- "Add 2 kilograms of apples to my list."

review: Good function to have however it is a bit temperamental. And that the any list app and the Alexa app don’t seamlessly sync with each other. And for example if you want to add an item to your grocery list with Alexa you have to be very specific  in your wording. Whereby if you were to say “add milk to my grocery list” it will create a separate list in the Alexa app versus adding to the grocery list that already exist. If your grocery list is just called “my Grocery you actually have to say add milk to my grocery” you cannot use the word “list” otherwise it creates a new list. So it’s a good concept but it takes a little bit to get used to using it and I has a few quirks.

name: Product Feedback
description: Product Feedback lets you give voice feedback on consumer products. This skill will capture opinions on and experience of mainstream brands in three categories. The categories include bodycare (e.g. Dove), haircare (e.g. Tresemme) and laundry (e.g. Comfort).
comment heading: Alexa devices are very unfrendly to elderly.
review:
I bought this product for my 97 year old father.  There are several obvious problems.
1. It speaks so fast that he cannot understand it.  I need to be able to slow down teh speech to help him understand.  In fact we can't train it to his voice because it only provides vocal sentences to repeat which of course he cannot because he cannot understand the sentences.  I cannot find a written list of the sentences on the web.
2. Alexa uses a female voce.  Elderly people often have great difficulty understanding female voices due to their high frequency content.  If a low frequency content male voice were available it would help considerably.  (i.e. he can understand men but not most women's speech.)  This is common. How did you guys miss this?
3. Alexa needs to be able to listen and recognize slower speech.  Elderly people often speak slower and insert brief silent pauses in their speech whiel they struggle to get their message across.  Alexa is extremely unforgivign in thsi regard...almos insulting.
I'm sorry I got his hopes up tellign him about this device because I don't think it will work for him.  Amazon has to stop writing all products with teh minset taht every user is a youth.  Somday they will get old too!

comment heading: This skill is the one we use the most
review: I use this skill at least 5 times a day. Everyone in our family loves being able to add things to all of our lists the minute something occurs to us. We have 27 AnyList lists and they're all Alexa enabled. This skill alone makes it worth having our Echo. I'm so thrilled the two are integrated. It works flawlessly!

review: Love the app, but the Alexa skill needs major improvement.  I have to switch from the "Alexa" list to my normal shopping list and then twice it has deleted everything in my list when I did not ask it to.  It should ask to confirm to delete all when so it doesn't misinterpret a command, or at least give you an option to undo it so you can recover your list!

description:
This skill requires users to have an account via the Mailhaven iOS app (see download link below).

Download the Mailhaven iOS app here 

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/mailhaven/id1189399189?ls=1&mt=8

Generally, a user will have packages being shipped to them and tracked on mailhaven app. This skill will allow users to ask mailhaven for information on their packages.

A user can ask for a status of all their undelivered packages. A user can also ask for the status of their last updated package (this package could be delivered, or in transit, etc...).

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

review: no Android

name: Out Of Milk
description:
With Out of Milk, manage your shopping list with just your voice. Easily add or remove various products and sync your lists with family and friends. Out of Milk lets you keep track of all of your lists, and automatically syncs to your phone. Keep your pantry and your fridge fresh!


Our Features:
-Easily create and edit your shopping lists
- Sync your shopping lists in real-time
- Quickly add and remove items on your lists
- Manage an inventory of your pantry
- Keep your lists synced from Alexa to your phone

You can always access your lists through our mobile apps and online on our website: http://www.outofmilk.com/. 


WHAT THE EXPERTS ARE SAYING:

'The Out of Milk app is straightforward and offers three main list functions: shopping, pantry and to do.'
Wall Street Journal

'#1 of Top 25 Apps For Moms'
Babble 

'Top 10 Most-Used Shopping Apps'
Nielsen  

'How To Simplify your grocery shopping on Android'
CNET  

'Grocery List Apps That Make Shopping, Syncing Lists Simple'
Mashable
review:
This Alexa skill is useful if you use the Out of Milk android app, but it has some serious problems. The phrases Alexa says while using this skill are unprofessional, and don't match the tone of either Alexa or the Out of Milk app. I am guessing a programmer threw this together and decided to make a joke of it, and no one in management has used it.

In addition to the incongruent tone, it doesn't have a confirmation before deleting all the items on a list. After adding an item to my list, I told Alexa, "That's all", and it misinterpreted it as "delete all" or "clear all" and promptly deleted everything on my list. I then said "undo", which it interpreted as "done" and exited the skill. If Alexa hears "delete all", she should respond with "You asked me to delete all the items on your [list name] list. Is that correct?", then only delete them if the user responds with "Yes".

I'll gladly upgrade my review to 5 stars if a confirmation is added before removing everything from the list, and if the phrases are changed to match Alexa's overall speech style and tone.

name: Simon
description:
Simon, the name behind America's iconic shopping destinations, via this Alexa skill lets you get center hours, store info and top deals for your favorite Simon Malls, Simon Mills and Simon Premium Outlets centers nationwide. 

Simply enable this Alexa skill to begin discovering the world of Simon.
review: Love this - simple utility but love getting info like this

name: Car Buying Tips
description:
Use 'Car Buying Tips' to learn a few great tips for negotiating the best price on your next ride! 

Receive tips for buying both used and new vehicles. 

Learn all the areas you can focus to get the price you can afford, negotiating on trade-in, purchase price, financing and more.
comment heading: Must try if in the market for a car!
review: Great tips, definitely will use next time we buy a car!

name: My Deal
description:
We find hundreds of deals every day and can’t wait to share with you. We tailor deals that interests you.. Tell us which deals you like, as we get to know you better, we will target deals that fits your preferences.

You will receive a four-character personal code (such as“DEMO”), which you can use to review the detail of the deals that you liked at www.mydealweb.com.


How to use:

To launch:
     “ Alexa, open my deal. ”

To search for particular deals by keyword (For example: Amazon, iPhone, Women's Outerwear):
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of Amazon. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal what are the deals for iPhone. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal to tell me the deals for women's outerwear. ”

If you find deals you are interested in, like them by numbers and view the detail on your phone:
     “ one, two and four ”
     “ second and third ”
     “ first two ”
     “ last one ”

Or go to the next group:
     “ next ”

Or want to listen again:
     “ repeat ”

Of cause you can always get help by:
     “ help ”

Or exist any time by:
     “ Alexa, stop. ”


How did we grow up:

Mar-18-2017:

	Now we can search for deals by keyword! Just say: “Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of (Keyword).”

Mar-08-2017:

	Now we have a website “www.mydealweb.com”, where you can review the deals you liked with your personal code! 

Feb-28-2017:

	Your deals are not randomly selected any more. They are based on what you liked before!

Feb-18-2017:

	Choose the deals you like by the Deal Number, we will send the detail via the Alexa App!

Feb-08-2017:

	Now you can listen to the next group of deals by saying “Next” or the previous group of deals by saying “Repeat”, and get help any time by saying “Help”.

Jan-28-2017:

	Launched! With 5 deals every time.


We're always learning and building new features, and we can't do that well without your feedback. If you have comments, please share them with us at www.mydealweb.com/feedback.
review: It can tell me deals from all market. But the list is very short right now.

review: This is the most used skill for me aside from the ones that control lights. we have always used Bring for our shopping list, and it’s just so easy to add an item to the list at any time - while in the middle of cooking, while searching the pantry, or when you finish the last of a bottle of ketchup. The speech recognition is extremely accurate for adding any item, even uncommon ones - it has yet to get anything wrong on the list!

name: GiftJoy
description:
Welcome to GiftJoy - the new, convenient, and enjoyable way to instantly send eGift cards to family and friends! 

You can choose from over 100 top retailers such as Starbucks, Fandango, Sephora, Barnes & Noble, Applebee's, Domino's, Uber, Nordstrom, Target, Old Navy, Kohl's, and Nike.  

Simply tell Alexa your order by saying: 

"Alexa, open GiftJoy!" or "Alexa, ask GiftJoy to send a gift card."

Through voice, you'll be prompted for your order details such as your name, the recipient's name, the gift card brand and value, when you want the eGift card to be delivered, and your personalized greeting.  

You'll then get a text message with a link to review your order and enter your payment details.  So don't worry if you make a mistake, you'll be able to easily make edits in the next step. 

The recipient will get a text message (or email, if you prefer) with a link to the eGift card, which can be redeemed online or in-store.  PLUS: if they prefer a different brand, they can make a swap without any fees.  That means you'll always be sending the perfect gift!

After you've placed an order, you can ask for your order history.  "Alexa, ask GiftJoy for my order history."  You'll also get notified  (via email) when the recipient opens their gift. 

Happy Gifting!!

We'd love to hear about your GiftJoy experience: team@giftjoy.us
Our website: giftjoy.us
List of Retailers: giftjoy.us/retailers
review: A great skill for sending gift cards.  check it out.

You will receive a four-character personal code (such as“DEMO”), which you can use to review the detail of the deals that you liked at www.mydealweb.com.


How to use:

To launch:
     “ Alexa, open my deal. ”

To search for particular deals by keyword (For example: Amazon, iPhone, Women's Outerwear):
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of Amazon. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal what are the deals for iPhone. ”
     “ Alexa, Ask My Deal to tell me the deals for women's outerwear. ”

If you find deals you are interested in, like them by numbers and view the detail on your phone:
     “ one, two and four ”
     “ second and third ”
     “ first two ”
     “ last one ”

Or go to the next group:
     “ next ”

Or want to listen again:
     “ repeat ”

Of cause you can always get help by:
     “ help ”

Or exist any time by:
     “ Alexa, stop. ”


How did we grow up:

Mar-18-2017:

	Now we can search for deals by keyword! Just say: “Alexa, Ask My Deal for the deals of (Keyword).”

Mar-08-2017:

	Now we have a website “www.mydealweb.com”, where you can review the deals you liked with your personal code! 

Feb-28-2017:

	Your deals are not randomly selected any more. They are based on what you liked before!

Feb-18-2017:

	Choose the deals you like by the Deal Number, we will send the detail via the Alexa App!

Feb-08-2017:

	Now you can listen to the next group of deals by saying “Next” or the previous group of deals by saying “Repeat”, and get help any time by saying “Help”.

Jan-28-2017:

	Launched! With 5 deals every time.


We're always learning and building new features, and we can't do that well without your feedback. If you have comments, please share them with us at www.mydealweb.com/feedback.
comment heading: I can pick up deals I like and get a list through generated specific code
review: Function got much improved. I can pick up deals I like and get a list through generated specific code. I like this skill.

name: Out Of Milk
description:
With Out of Milk, manage your shopping list with just your voice. Easily add or remove various products and sync your lists with family and friends. Out of Milk lets you keep track of all of your lists, and automatically syncs to your phone. Keep your pantry and your fridge fresh!


Our Features:
-Easily create and edit your shopping lists
- Sync your shopping lists in real-time
- Quickly add and remove items on your lists
- Manage an inventory of your pantry
- Keep your lists synced from Alexa to your phone

You can always access your lists through our mobile apps and online on our website: http://www.outofmilk.com/. 


WHAT THE EXPERTS ARE SAYING:

'The Out of Milk app is straightforward and offers three main list functions: shopping, pantry and to do.'
Wall Street Journal

'#1 of Top 25 Apps For Moms'
Babble 

'Top 10 Most-Used Shopping Apps'
Nielsen  

'How To Simplify your grocery shopping on Android'
CNET  

'Grocery List Apps That Make Shopping, Syncing Lists Simple'

review: Let me start by saying that the Out of Milk app is an excellent choice for cross platform shopping list sharing.  However, the Alexa skill has a fatal flaw that forces me to warn other users to stay away for now.  The flaw is that it tends to recognize some phrases as a request to erase the entire shopping list.  Alexa then dutifully wipes your list without warning.  Until an improved delete routine is created, including a verbal warning and request for acknowledgement, I will have to disable the skill.

name: eBags
description: Use Alexa to ask questions about all youreBags orders. Get status updates any time you like with the voice-activated convenience you love from Alexa.
review: The bag was on-sale and when I tried to use the 25% off coupon I just got for signing up it wouldn't let me.  Then I tried another 20% discount on the site and no good.  Then I got an option that said they couldn't discount as the discount had already been figured in.  What a crock!  It was discounted before I even tried any discounts or codes!  Then I had an Option 1 and 2 to make it up to me.  Both options were the same and said basically Ok you'll pay no shipping or sales tax.  Well, the shipping was already free as the bag was over $49.00 but I could still save $5.00 on tax.  Not so fast!  When I checked out the sales tax was there.  And so was the shipping!  I was able to uncheck the shipping but what the heck was the sales tax promise all about?  Not sure what e-Bags act is but I think they need to cut back on the ganga in their corporate offices during working hours there in Denver!!!

name: GlobalGiving
description: This skill lets you find information about projects on GlobalGiving.  You can ask about the current featured projects or about specific ones if you already know what you are looking for.  If you want to find some projects in a thematic area, like technology, all you have to do is ask and we will give you some suggestions.

name: Best Buy
description:
Get Best Buy's latest deals using only your voice. You can also search for products, track your order status, hear store hours and locations, and get answers to frequently asked questions.

For the best shopping experience, take a moment to link your Best Buy account. And to make ordering even easier, make sure you have a default credit card and shipping address stored at BestBuy.com. If while using our skill you choose to have a text sent with more information, Best Buy will need access to your Amazon account mobile number.  Go to the home screen in your Alexa app to grant permission.

Use the Best Buy skill to:
- Buy our latest deals, including special voice-only offers
- Search our product catalog
- Get updated order status information
- Locate a store near you
- Learn about Best Buy’s return policy, or get answers to other FAQs
- Ask for tech tips like, "how do I set a default printer" or "help me with my modem"
- Discover gift ideas or purchase Best Buy gift cards

name: GiftJoy
description:
Welcome to GiftJoy - the new, convenient, and enjoyable way to instantly send eGift cards to family and friends! 

You can choose from over 100 top retailers such as Starbucks, Fandango, Sephora, Barnes & Noble, Applebee's, Domino's, Uber, Nordstrom, Target, Old Navy, Kohl's, and Nike.  

Simply tell Alexa your order by saying: 

"Alexa, open GiftJoy!" or "Alexa, ask GiftJoy to send a gift card."

Through voice, you'll be prompted for your order details such as your name, the recipient's name, the gift card brand and value, when you want the eGift card to be delivered, and your personalized greeting.  

You'll then get a text message with a link to review your order and enter your payment details.  So don't worry if you make a mistake, you'll be able to easily make edits in the next step. 

The recipient will get a text message (or email, if you prefer) with a link to the eGift card, which can be redeemed online or in-store.  PLUS: if they prefer a different brand, they can make a swap without any fees.  That means you'll always be sending the perfect gift!

After you've placed an order, you can ask for your order history.  "Alexa, ask GiftJoy for my order history."  You'll also get notified  (via email) when the recipient opens their gift. 

Happy Gifting!!

We'd love to hear about your GiftJoy experience: team@giftjoy.us
Our website: giftjoy.us
List of Retailers: giftjoy.us/retailers

review: Had a stroke in early 2017.  AnyList was the answer.  Lists work across my iPhone, iPads, Mac Pro, imac, etc.  The Recipe function is fantastic if you cook a lot like I do, esp the browser/import function.  Thumbs way up!

It also includes our pick of the week at the top of every broadcast. New episodes are released every week. Add us to your flash briefing to never miss out on the latest comics!

review: I downloaded a number of these skills and I’m so glad I did. Now I can just ask Alexa to play one of them and it changes the whole ambiance of the room. I feel like I work better when one of these is playing in the background. The creators did a wonderful job!

skills-rest: Deal of the Day Flash Briefing
name: Deal of the Day Flash Briefing
description: Find new products and ways to save every day by adding the Deal of the Day Flash Briefing to your life.
review: I love my Flash Briefings. Very informative! I also like how Alexa addresses me by my name for this skill. I wish it addressed me by my name all the time, now that would be cool...

name: Zen Buggy
description:
The Zen Buggy skill allows users with an active account on zenbuggy.com to add items to their grocery list via voice control.

What makes Zen Buggy different is that, as you are shopping, you can mark the aisle locations of the items on your list and then check them off as you add them to your cart. Then, the next time you add those items to your list, they will automatically show up on the correct aisle. Aso, items tagged by other shoppers at the same store will show up as well, but you can easily change the location(s) if items have moved, etc...

Zen Buggy also supports multiple stores, and you can easily move items between them. Items moved will always show up on the correct aisle, as long as they have previously been tagged by you or another shopper.

Pro tip: Use the word "And" between items to add multiple items to your list. Zen Buggy looks for that word and uses it to separate your sentence into distinct items. For instance, saying "Add Peanut Butter and Grape Jelly" would show up as two separate line items. Try it!
review: Zen Buggy has a simple clean design that is easy use from any smartphone, computer, or Alexa enabled device. Add an item to your list, track which aisle it's on in the store, to shorten time spent in the store in the future, and shop faster and smarter. Aisle data is crowd sourced, so the more people that use it for your store, the faster you can shop, so remember to invite your friends, family, and neighbors to use Zen Buggy.

name: Bring! Shopping List
description:
Planning and managing your grocery shopping is a breeze with the new Alexa skill.
Create your Bring! user account first. The free download is available for both iPhone and Android.

Thanks to the user-friendly shopping list and clever sharing functions, everyone in your household is always aware of what needs to be bought. This way you save a lot of time and money while shopping. Try it out now.

You can:
- Add articles with “Open Bring and add two liters of milk.”
- Remove articles with “Open Bring and remove milk.”
- Let Alexa read the articles on your list with “Open Bring and read my list.”
- Change the list with “Open Bring and change my list to Home.”

To do multiple things consecutively start with
- "Alexa open Bring."
After the welcome message continue with
 - "Change the default list to Home."
 - "What is on my list?"
 - "Add 2 liter of milk to my list."


More info under www.getbring.com.

Send us your feedback to feedback@getbring.com

Happy shopping with Bring!
comment heading: Bring no longer working with Alexa
review: Unfortunately this was five stars until the Bring profile and password had to be changed, and now the app no longer works with Alexa.  Other than Alexa, all our devices are synced and the skill on Alexa was disabled and reenabled with the new profile and password multiple times and Alexa is still unable to communicate with Bring. Sad.

name: shopper
description: Protein is the most expensive part of any meal, and you can save a lot of money buying it on sale. With this app you can say, "Alexa, ask meat seeker who is selling the cheapest chicken thighs", and it tell you where in Seattle to buy it and for how much. The weekly circular data from multiple local grocery stores is automatically collected via a backend web crawler into a database, which meat seeker uses to find the best bargains for you.

comment heading: Beware! Emptied my ENTIRE list without confirming!
review: I said, "Alexa, ask Out of Milk to add small disposables to the list." Alexa replied, "Your list has been cleared of all items" - and it WAS. That was TERRIBLE programming, to clear a list without even confirming. That isn't even an ability Alexa should have, since there is no way to recover a list cleared in error! Skill disabled, of course, but the damage was done. There is no way I could give it more than 1 star or recommend it to any Out of Milk users.

name: Carter's Customer Service
description: Use Alexa to ask questions about all your  Carter's, OshKosh B'gosh or Skip Hop orders. Get status updates any time you like with the voice-activated convenience you love from Alexa.
review: Great Products & wonderful Customer Service - Used Carter Products since the early 70's and now for Grandchildren.  Carter has never compromised their quality in the 48+ years I have bought their Products for myself and as gifts for Family & Friends - which is rare today!  Love the Alexa Option too,

name: Purell
description:
PURELL® products are trusted and used in hospitals to help prevent the spread of infection. Now that same germ-fighting power is available for everyone - at home, at work and on the go. 

From innovative soap and sanitizer formulation, to breakthrough dispensing systems and portable solutions, the same commitment to well-being goes into every product we make.

We bring that same commitment to our new Amazon Alexa skill, PURELL® Assistant, which will share our hand hygiene and sanitation know-how with new and long-time friends alike. Use this skill to find out more about our gentle, effective products and to hear tips for keeping your family healthy and well.

Disclaimer: The information in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.

name: Macy's Orders
description:
This skill allows users to track their orders through the Alexa App and Echo. To use this skill, follow these instructions:
1- Subscribe to link your package to your Alexa account through the tracking page sent to you by Macy's.
2- Interact with your Alexa enabled device by asking one of the following questions, Alexa, ask Macy's Orders where is my package or Alexa, ask Macy's Orders to track package

description: This skill allows you to quickly and easily learn about Woot's daily deals on any of the Woot categories. To get started, you just have to ask Woot for the daily deal. You can also get more specific by asking about deals in a particular category such as shirt deal.
review: Works great. Now if I don't want to open a browser window for Woot I can have Alexa tell me what's offered.

name: MailHaven Package Tracker
description:
This skill requires users to have an account via the Mailhaven iOS app (see download link below).

Download the Mailhaven iOS app here 

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/mailhaven/id1189399189?ls=1&mt=8

Generally, a user will have packages being shipped to them and tracked on mailhaven app. This skill will allow users to ask mailhaven for information on their packages.

A user can ask for a status of all their undelivered packages. A user can also ask for the status of their last updated package (this package could be delivered, or in transit, etc...).
comment heading: The best package tracking skill on here
review: This is by far the best skill on here, glad I found it.

name: Edmunds
description:
Edmunds brings more than 50 years of automotive knowledge to your Alexa-enabled device with a  new way to access car shopping and ownership tools. Now, Alexa can help you shop for a car, appraise a vehicle, calculate cost of ownership, find out when your next service is due, and much more. 

Available topics: pros and cons, driving characteristics, safety, powertrain, warranty, fuel efficiency, seating capacity, length, width, height, price, cost, cargo capacity, headroom, curb weight, towing capacity, wheelbase, inventory, lease deals, dealers, recalls, maintenance, and true market value.
review: Asked how much the Ford escape was, she said sorry I don't know that

name: Discount Contacts Reorder
description:
The best way to reorder contacts from DiscountContacts.com is with voice shopping! Simply say “Alexa, reorder contacts with Discount Contacts” to your Echo or Dot and the skill will set up an order from your last purchase at DiscountContacts.com, including 10 percent off every voice order.
 
Alexa will offer you the option to create a four digit pin for more secure ordering. To complete the transaction, the Discount Contacts Reorder Skill will read back your last order, and if it’s correct, tell Alexa “yes” to complete your order. The charge will be placed on the credit card DiscountContacts.com has on file. The prescription will be verified by our Customer Service Team and any required Rx updates will be communicated to you by phone or email.
 
Your first order must be placed via the DiscountContacts.com website, mobile site, or with our Customer Service Team at 1-800-822-9864. After your initial order you can reorder via Alexa using your DiscountContacts.com account.
 
DiscountContacts.com is the best place to shop for contact lenses online. Find cheap contacts from Acuvue, Air Optix, Biofinity, Dailies, Biotrue, Proclear, and more.
 
o   New customers receive 20% off their first order
o   Free shipping over $99
o   365-day returns
o   Lowest prices guaranteed
o   Wide selection of contacts from toric contact lenses, daily contacts, multifocal/presbyopia contact lenses, and more
o   Receive discounts, sales, and coupons on glasses, prescription sunglasses, reading glasses, and other eyewear from our sister site DiscountGlasses.com
comment heading: This is a very specific skill...
review:
...but it works flawlessly. Once you place an order for contact lenses from discountcontactlenses.com and enable this skill, you'll be able to quickly and easily reorder them by just asking Alexa. Note that she will read back your order number at normal reading speed... but you don't have to memorize it - you'll get an email to your registered email account shortly thereafter.

I have an echo dot in my bathroom, and I can forsee opening the drawer and finding I only have one or two contacts left in the box and having my virtual butler Alexa ask Discount Contacts to reorder them instantaneously. In fact, come to think of it, I think I'll write the phrase on the box itself so I have it ready for the next order. Highly recommended.

name: AnyList
description:
AnyList is the best way to create and share grocery shopping lists, and this skill allows you to add items to AnyList with Alexa.

To get started, first download AnyList from the iOS App Store and create an AnyList account. Then enable this skill and you'll be able to link your AnyList account to Alexa.

After linking your AnyList account, the Alexa Shopping & To-do lists will appear as new lists in AnyList. From the AnyList app, you can also choose to make some or all of your existing AnyList lists accessible on your Alexa devices.
comment heading: Access to recipes would be nice
review: I love being able to add items to my shopping list via Alexa, however, now that I have the Echo Show, it would be great if I could access my recipes that I have saved through AnyList and my meal plan!

name: UK Deal Finder
description:
Never miss a deal on HotUKDeals.com again with this skill. Simply ask Alexa "Alexa ask UK Deal Finder to get deals" and she will dutifully reply with the top 5 Hot Deals. Maybe you want to be on the pulse and would like the New deals, simply ask "Alexa, ask UK Deal Finder for top 10 new deals" and she will tell you about the latest new deals.

Disclaimer: The content comes from the HotUKDeals site and as such may not be suitable for all ages.

name: AnyList
description:
